He has many ambitions for his businesses, because these allow him to generate income for his family, as he is married and has two minor children. 

One of the problems he has in performing his work at 100% is his hearing disability. He wants to improve his business and that is why he wants to improve his service by offering chair rental for events. That is why he is requesting a loan. This way he will have all the services that his customers ask for.

loans.use: To buy chairs.

loans.name: Yanira Yaneth

texts.es: Yanira vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y fríjol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, sus cosechas las comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; ella necesita invertir en sus cosechas por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semillas de maíz, fríjol, insecticida, herbicida, etc. Yanira  tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Yanira lives with her life companion and their 3 children in her own house. She dedicates herself to cultivating corn and beans. She has various years of working in agriculture and this has offered her much experience, allowing her to obtain the best harvests. 

Yanira sells her harvests in the surrounding communities. She already has lots of customers who prefer her produce for its quality, good prices, and, above all, for her good service. 

Yanira needs to invest in her harvests and, to do this, she is requesting a loan that will permit her to purchase corn and bean seeds, insecticieds, herbicides, etc. Yanira has good payment references from those who know her; she is very responsible. She assures us that she will be able to pay off the debt in the period established, and at the same time, she will bring economic security to her home.

loans.use: buy corn and bean seeds, plus insecticides, herbicides, etc., for sowing her crops.

loans.name: Adjoa Ewusi

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances Adjoa did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Adjoa prepares and sells ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian staple dish that is made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves) in Nkontrodo (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 40 years. 
As a widow with one child, Adjoa uses all her income to provide for her and her family. Adjoa will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will aid her in improving her overall ‘Kenkey’ sales. Adjoa wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that her child is able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will aid her in improving her overall ‘Kenkey’ sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize

loans.name: Duyen

texts.en: Duyen was born in 1986. She has two daughters who attend primary school and kindergarten. Her husband raises doves and birds. His income is about 6,000,000 VND. Duyen sells clothes to earn a living. Besides that, she also embroiders pictures to sell in the market. She earns about 5,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for five years. Her family’s total earnings are about 11,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in life and work are lacking of capital to buy food for birds and to buy clothes in wholesale. Her dream is to open an embroidered pictures shop. This loan is one of steps helps her reaching to this dream. She can invest in her clothing shop to gain earnings and save the profits for opening the embroidery shop. Duyen has a passion in business. She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2006. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,810,000 VND and repaid on time. In this new loan cycle, she would like to borrow 11,118,000 VND to buy clothes for her shop. She always wants to expand her business and raise her children up well.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her shop.

loans.name: David Antonio

texts.es: David  de 41 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 4 años siembra fríjol y maíz y con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es un hombre responsable, honesto y trabajador actualmente vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos. David  está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, etc. ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y así tener mejores ingresos y tener una mejor estabilidad económica
texts.en:
David, 41 years old has been farming for four years. He plants beans and corn and pays for household expenses from the sale of his crops. He is a responsible, honest and hardworking man. He currently lives with his wife and four children.

David is applying for a loan so that he can purchase supplies for his crops, such as fertilizers, compost, seeds, etc. since his earnings do not cover the cost of supplies. The loan will enable him to earn more and have better economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, compost, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Duyet's Group

texts.en:
Duyet was born in 1965. She has three children. Two of her children are adults and her youngest daughter is learning at school. Her husband is sick and he can’t earn money. Duyet raises chickens and sells fish in the market. She earns about 5,000,000 VND (Vietnamese Dong) per month. She has done this job for four years. 
Her family’s total earnings are about 8,000,000 VND per month. Duyet's challenge in life and work is lack of capital to buy food for her chickens and to buy fish. Her dream is that her children can grow up well and be successful in life. This loan is one of the steps that helps her in reaching this dream. Duyet can invest in her farm to gain earnings and save profit for her family. Duyet is a hardworking woman. 
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2013. In this first loan cycle, she would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy food for her chickens and additional fish to sell in the market. She always wants to expand this business to earn a living.
Other members who are part of Duyet's group include the following: 
 Suu is 63 years old. She has a child. She is a farmer. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to raise chickens. 
 Hang is 23 years old. She is a farmer. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to raise chickens. 
 Huong is 32 years old. She has two children. She is a worker. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to raise chickens. 
 Dong is 38 years old. She has two children. She is a worker. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to raise chickens.

loans.use: to buy food for chicken and additional fish to sell in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of cooked rice

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette is 50 years old and widowed with six children. She runs a wood sales business in Tombo, a western rural area in Freetown. She started the business because she wants to generate a permanent source of income.  

She's been in this business for two years and sells wood at her house.  he describes her major hardships as inadequate funds to run her business and transportation issues.  

Janette requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more wood in order to expand her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to change her business to a food stand store. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more wood in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu is 30 years old and married with four children between the ages of 2 years and 10 years old. She runs a fish vending business in Tombo, a western rural area in Sierra Leone. She started this business to earn her daily living. Her husband is a driver, but his income is not enough to support the home.

She's been in this business since an early age and sells fish within her community. She says, at present, she is facing a storage problem in her business.

Isatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more fish for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, she would like to expand her business to a big fish table. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 55-year-old Isatu from Tombo in a western rural area. She is widowed with three children. She began this business to create a permanent source of income to support her needs. 

Isatu runs a food stand business; she sells pepper, Maggi, and cooking seasonings within her community. She began running this business immediately after her husband died. She works at the business ten hours per day and seven days per week. Isatu says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Isatu has requested a loan in order to purchase more cooking ingredients, such as rice, oil and pepper, for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to provide for her daily meals and increase her business. In the future, she plans to renovate her house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking ingredients, such as rice, oil and pepper, for resale.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: José de 42 años de edad es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos el se dedica a ser agricultor siembra maíz y fríjol. José desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso ha solicitado un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos,fertilizantes, entre otras cosas, para seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en:
José, 42 years old, is a man who is very responsible with his household obligations since he has always been known to provide the best for his family. He currently lives with his wife and three children. He is a farmer who plants corn and beans.

José wants to increase sales. Consequently, he has requested a loan that will enable him to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer, among other items, so that he can continue to put bread o the table in his home.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of frozen meat

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.en: After graduating middle school, Adjowa decided to set up her own doughnut business in Nkontrodo (near Cape Coast). With over 16 years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more sugar, flour, and oil. She aims at using the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a gas station attendant) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their six children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to help her purchase more sugar, flour, and oil

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Aminata from Tombo, Western Rural Area, in Freetown. She is married with two children between the ages of 1 year and 15 years old. Two of her children are currently attending school. Twenty-five years ago, Betty established her palm oil business. She began her business because she was trained in the business and she needs to generate income to support the home. She works at the business ten hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run her business.

Aminata requires a loan in order to buy more palm oil for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, Aminata plans to expand the business even more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 40 years old and married with two children, ages 4 years and 15 years old. She runs a rice sales business in Tombo, Western Rural Area, in Sierra Leone. She started this business to earn a daily living. Her husband is a driver, but his income is not enough to support the home.

She started this business just after she got married and sells rice within her community. She says, at present, her business is doing well because with the profits, she is able to take care of her family.

Emma requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase different kinds of rice for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, she would like to expand her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of rice for resale.

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Ramatu is in her early 30s and married with two children, ages 4 years and 8 years old. She runs a fish vending business in Tombo, Western Rural Area, in Sierra Leone. She started this business to earn a daily living.

She's been in this business since around 2000, after she got married, and sells fish in her area. She says, at present, her business is doing well because with the profits, she is able to take of her family.

Ramatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more fish for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to increase her business and repay her loan. In the future, she would like to expand her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 40-year-old Kadiatu from Tombo, Western rural area. She is single with two children, ages 15 years and 25 years. One of her children is attending school. 

Kadiatu runs a general stock business. She sells cigarettes, biscuits, and soft drinks within her community. She has been running this business since 2000. She works at the business ten hours per day and seven days per week. Kadiatu says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Kadiatu has requested a loan in order to purchase more cigarettes, biscuits, and soft drinks for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cigarettes, biscuits, and soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 31-year-old, married woman. She lives with her husband and three children, who are attending school. Her husband is the main income provider for the family. Zeinab has been working as a hairdresser and beautician, for the past five years. She works at her house, and she also visits customers at their domiciles, to provide them with her talented hairdressing and beauty services. She also sells cosmetics, in order to earn extra income and be able to support her family well, financially.

Today, she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l, to purchase beauty products and hairdressing supplies. She is well-known in her region and neighboring towns by her good reputation. She is certain that with the new products, she will be able to attract more customers and consequently, increase her income. In the future, she hopes to open her own beauty salon where she will receive her customers professionally.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products and hairdressing supplies

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Lucinda from Tombo, a western rural area. She is married with three children between the agess of 6 and 13 years. Two of her children attend school. 

Lucinda runs a cloth business. She sells wax cotton and tie-dye material within her community. She has been running this business since 2001. Lucinda works at the business ten hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Lucinda has requested a loan in order to purchase more wax cotton and tie-dye for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to start a savings account and increase her business. In the future, she plans to open a big clothing shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more wax cotton and tie-dye for resale.

loans.name: Sia

texts.en:
Sia is 45 years old and married with five children, ages 7 years through 25 years. She runs a fish business in Tombo, a western rural area in Sierra Leone. She started this business to get her daily living. Her husband is a security guard but his income is not enough to support the home.

She's been in this business since just after she got married and sells fish within her community. She says that at present her business is doing well because out of the profit she was able to take care of her family.

Sia requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more fish for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, she would like to expand her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is Mariatu from Tombo, Western Rural Area. She is in her 40s and married with three children between the ages of 10 years and 30 years old. Two of her children attend school. 

Mariatu runs a clothing sales business; she sells used clothing within her community. She has been running this business since 2001. She works at the business ten hours per day and seven days per week. Mariatu says the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Mariatu has requested a loan in order to purchase more used clothing for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to a have permanent business residence and increase her business. In the future, she plans to open a used clothing shop. She thanks you for your support

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 25-year-old Salamatu from Tombo, Western Rural Area. She is married with one child who is three years old. 

Salamatu runs a clothing business; she sells wax cotton within her community. She has been running this business since 2003. She works at the business ten hours per day and seven days per week. Salamatu says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Salamatu has requested a loan in order to purchase more wax cotton for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her status of living and increase her business. In the future, she plans to open a big clothing shop. She thanks you for your support

loans.use: to purchase more wax cotton for resale.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Isatu from Tombo, Western Rural Area, in Sierra Leone. She is married with three children between the ages of 3 months and 10 years old. Two of her children are currently attending school. In 2000, Isatu established her general stock business. She began her business because she needed to create income to improve her standard of living. She works at the business seven days per week, from morning to night. She says that the main challenge to her business is transportation.

Isatu requires a loan in order to buy more pure water and soda for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to take good care of her family and increase her business. In the future, Isatu plans to build a permanent residence for her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more pure water and soda for resale.

loans.name: Karoson

texts.ru: Человек с огромным сердцем доброты и прекрасной душой, планирует развевать бизнес. Ее зовут Каросон. Ей 47 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет одну 15 летнюю дочь и одного совершеннолетнего сына. Ее муж пенсионер и имеет маленькую пенсию. Каросон более 26 лет занимается скотоводством. Она имеет большой опыт, так как с детства она помогала маме откармливать скот. После замужества она продолжала заниматься скотоводством, так как ее муж не имел большой доход.  Она с бизнесом справляется сама. Каросон хочет развевать бизнес и увеличить доход, так как дети выросли и надо сделать сбережения для проведения их свадьбы. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: This is a person with a huge heart and a tremendous spirit who is planning to expand her business. Her name is Karoson. She is 47, married, and has one 15 year-old daughter and one son who is grown up. Her husband is retired and has a small pension. Karoson has been involved in animal husbandry for more than 26 years. She is very experienced, for starting when she was very young, she helped her mother feed the cattle. She continued to raise livestock after she got married, for her husband did not earn much income. She runs the business by herself. Karoson wants to expand her busines and increase  her income, for her children are grown and she needs to save up for their weddings. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1000 somoni to buy cattle. She awaits your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: La señora Martha Lorena. habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su familia, su esposo la apoya en todas sus decisiones ademas le ayuda con los gastos del hogar ya que trabaja para una empresa privada desde hace mucho tiempo, ella labora como domestica en una casa privada, con este credito compra materiales como: Bloques, Hierro, Arena para realizar un porche en la parte trasera de su casa para evitar que en el  invierno se filtre el agua, Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado.
texts.en:
Martha Lorena lives in the town of Ticuantepe with her family. Her husband supports her in all of her decisions and helps her with their household expenses, since he has been working for a private company for a very long time. She works as a domestic in a private home. 

She will use this loan to purchase materials like blocks, iron, and sand, in order to build a porch in the back of her house so that water doesn't seep in during the winter. 

She is grateful for the support that Afodenic and Kiva funds have given her.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor Juan Antonio, posee un negocio de distribuir jugos y gaseosas variadas al por mayor y detalle en el  departamento de León, siendo este negocio la manutención  de su familia.

Don Juan Antonio  se presentó a las oficinas de Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito para la compra de jugos y gaseosas ya que en este mes quiere aprovechar las ventas debido a la demanda presentada por su clientela. 

Este trabajo lo realiza para aumentar sus ingresos y de esa manera mejorar su  nivel de vida y el de su  familia.
texts.en:
Juan Antonio owns a business distributing wholesale and retail juice and soda in the department of León. This business provides for his family.

Juan Antonio came to the Ceprodel office to request a loan to purchase juice and soda, because this month he wants to make the most of his sales due to his customers' demand. 

He does this work in order to increase his income and improve his and his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy juice and assorted soda.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria, de 60 años, es divorciada y vive en su  casa propia. Sus hijos ya son independientes y viven en otros lugares.El trabajo de Victoria consiste en  diseño, confección  y venta de ropas para damas, caballeros y niños. Realiza esta actividad en un local en el interior de su vivienda.Comenta que se  inicio en esta actividad por la necesidad de conseguir un empleo y como había estudiado confecciones industriales, decidió poner su negocio.Considera rentable su negocio porque vende sus mercadería a  sus amigos, familiares y vecinos. Antes de iniciarse en este negocio su esposo se hacia cargo de los gastos de su hogar, pero la abandono entonces ella decidió seguir adelante y ejercer lo que había estudiado. Espera seguir manteniendo  su negocio porque le brinda  buenas ganancias económicas y puede solventar los gastos de su hogar.Por tanto éste será su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que le brindan para seguir adelante.
Con el monto solicitado de S/.1000 soles comprará materiales como telas, blondas, elásticos e hilos para seguir confeccionando  y completar el numero de pedidos que le hicieron en estás últimas semanas.
texts.en:
Victoria, 60, is divorced and lives in her own house.  Her children are already independent and live in other places.

Victoria's job is designing, making, and selling clothing for women, men, and children.  She does this work in a space inside her home.  She says she started this work because she needed a job.  She had studied industrial sewing, so she decided to set up her business.

She considers her business profitable because she sells her merchandise to her friends, family members, and neighbors.  Before she started this business her husband had taken care of the household expenses, but when he abandoned her she decided to get ahead and practice what she had studied.

She hopes to continue supporting her business because it gives her good profits and she can cover her household expenses.  This will be her second loan with Kiva.  She's very happy for the financial support she's getting so she can get ahead.

With the requested amount of 1000 soles [PEN] she'll buy materials such as fabric, lace, elastic, and thread to continue making clothing and finish the requests from the last few weeks.

loans.use: to buy fabric, lace, elastic, and other materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase toys, baby items, walkers, carriages, footwear and baby bottles.

loans.name: Chung's Group

texts.en:
Chung was born in 1955. He has a son who is a policeman. His wife is a teacher. Her income is 4,000,000 VND (Vietnamese Dong) per month. Chung raises doves and chickens. Besides that he also is a farmer and a building worker. He earns about 4,000,000 VND per month. He has done this job for five years. His family’s total earnings are about 11,000,000 VND per month. Chung's challenges in life and work are the lack of capital to buy food for his doves. His dream is to have a stable life. This loan is one of the steps to help him in reaching this dream. He can invest in his farm to gain earnings and save profit for his life. Chung is a hardworking man. 
He has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2013. In this first loan cycle, he would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy food for raising doves and chickens. 	
Other members who are part of Chung's group include the following: 
Dien is 28 years old. He has a child. He is a worker. He wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to plant fruits trees. 
Duong is 50 years old. She has two children. She is a meat seller. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to raise chickens. 
Lan is 45 years old. She has two children. She is a worker. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to raise chickens. 
Tan is 52 years old. She has a child. She is a farmer. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to raise chickens.

loans.use: to buy food for raising doves and chickens

loans.name: Saffie

texts.en:
Saffie is 45 years old and married, with one child, age 28 years. She runs a fish business in Tombo, a western rural area in Sierra Leone. She strives to earn a living. Her husband is a fisherman with three dependents at home, so his income is not enough to support the home.

She's been in this business since just after she got married and she sells fish in a busy market. She says that, at present, her business is doing well because, out of the profit, she was able to take care of her family.

Saffie requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone Microfinance Company Limited to buy more fish for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Mabinty from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children who are between the ages of 10 and 23 years. Two of her children are currently attending school. In 2006, Mabinty established her fish business. She began her business because she needed to generate income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours a day, 7 days a week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run her business.

Mabinty requires a loan in order to buy more fish and palm oil to resell. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her level of living. In the future, Mabinty plans to expand her business even more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more fish and palm oil to resell.

loans.name: Abdunabi

texts.ru: Абдунаби молодой парень в возрасте 29 лет. Он женат и имеет двоих маленьких детей. Абдунаби живёт со своей семьёй в небольшом посёлке. Все соседи относятся к нему хорошо, так как он проявляет себя как отзывчивый и добрый человек, который всегда готов помочь тому, кто  нуждается в  помощи. С детства Абдунаби  помогал своему отцу в его ремесле, его отец был плотником. Так Абдунаби и сам научился этому делу от своего отца. Он начинал с маленьких построек, но сейчас он может построить большой дом. Вот уже как 8 лет он занимается этим делом, принимает заказы на строительство, выполняет эту работу и получает хороший стабильный доход. Спрос на его труд есть в разное время года. Абдунаби имеет очень много клиентов, которые оценивают его работу как качественно и добросовестно выполненную. В данный момент Абдунаби хочет построить для своей семьи хороший новый дом и для этого ему нужны денежные средства. Ему нужно закупить много строительных материалов для строительства запланированного дома. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит для закупа строительных материалов. Абдунаби надеется на поддержку и заранее благодарит.
texts.en: Abdunabu is a young fellow of 29. He is married and has two young daughters. Abdunabu lives with his family in a small village. He gets along fine with all of his neighbors, for he is a sensitive and kind person who is always ready to help anyone in need. As a young boy, Abdunabu used to help his father, who was a carpenter. And he learned this trade from his father. He started with small structures, but now he can build a large house. He has been working as a carpenter for 8 years, taking orders for construction, performing the work, and earning a good, stable income. His work is in demand throughout the year. He has many clients who consider his work to be both of high quality and thorough. At the moment Abdunabu wants to build a new house for his family and needs financing. He needs to buy lots of building materials to build this planned house. So he has come to Arvand and is requesting a loan to buy building materials. Abdunabu is counting on your support and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es: Rosalba, 32 años de edad, casada, desde hace un año se dedica a la confección de ropa deportiva junto con su hermana la cual venden a los diferentes puestos ubicados en la zona, ellas se dedican a confeccionar la ropa de lunes a viernes y los sábados distribuyen los pedidos a los diferentes clientes, por semana le encargan la mercadería que más necesitan. Doña Rosalba desea este crédito para invertir en la compra de telas ya que su clientela ha aumentado y le solicitan muchos conjuntos deportivos, ya que son de calidad y preferencia para los clientes. Logrando estas ventas semanales ella aporta económicamente al hogar, además paga gastos adicionales que soliciten en el colegio de sus hijos, ella se siente muy motivada con esta actividad ya que ha logrado sufragar gastos que antes solo generaba su esposo.Este es el segundo crédito de doña Rosalba, ella prefiere a Fundación Mujer por el buen servicio, bajas tasas de interés y porque vamos hasta la zona atender la solicitud. Inicia con esta actividad debido a que en la zona no existen suficientes fuentes de trabajo, esto les ha permitido superación personal y deciden continuar hasta donde puedan porque es un buen negocio.
texts.en:
Rosalba is 32 years old, married, and for the last year has worked making athletic clothing together with her sister who sells the clothing at different locations in the area. The two work making the clothing Monday through Friday, and on Saturdays they distribute the orders to their various customers. During the week they are in charge of the merchandise that they need. Rosalba seeks this loan in order to purchase fabrics because her customers have increased and they request many athletic outfits, as hers are quality and preferred by her customers. Earning these weekly sales she is able to economically support her household, in addition to paying additional costs that arise in the high school her two children attend. She is very motivated by this work as she is now able to cover expenses that once only her husband could manage.

This is Rosabla's second loan cycle. She prefers to work with the Fundación Mujer (Women's Foundation) for their good service, low interest rates, and because they come all they out to handle the request. She started in this line of work due to the high level of unemployment in her region, and this work has granted her a way to get ahead personally and decide to continue as long as she can because it is a good business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Mujeres De Negocio Group

texts.es: Lucy, 34 años de edad, soltera, se dedica a la venta de ropa, perfumes y calzado que compra en diferentes distribuidoras de la zona, ella sola se dedica a la compra y venta de estos artículos ya que esto le permite generar ingresos al hogar; todos los meses invierte suficiente en la compra de mercadería que le encargan, a las clientas con más tiempo les brinda un mes de plazo, si es nueva preferiblemente pide un adelanto y en dos semanas recauda el resto del dinero. Solicita este crédito para invertir en más mercadería ya que su clientela ha aumentado y presenta mayor necesidades que ella puede cubrir, en la zona la prefieren porque tiene precios bajos y brinda crédito con un mes de plazo. Este es el segundo crédito que ella solicita, anteriormente se presento con excelente moral de pago, eligió Fundación Mujer por el buen servicio, baja tasa de interés y porque nos desplazamos hasta la zona atender el crédito. Desea continuar con esta actividad por que es un medio por el cual obtiene ingresos al hogar ya que en la zona no existen suficientes fuentes de empleo, en estos dos años le ha ido muy bien y ella desea continuar creciendo en la actividad y personalmente adquirir más experiencia y mejorar en lo que sea posible.
texts.en: Lucy is 34 years old and single.  She makes a living selling clothes, perfume and footwear that she buys from different distributors in the area.  Lucy works alone buying and selling these articles as it allows her to earn an income for the household.  Every month Lucy invests enough in buying the merchandise that her customers have ordered.  If Lucy has known a customer for some time, she will give them one month to pay for the shoes; if the customer is new, however, she asks for some money up-front and then gives them two weeks to pay.  Lucy is applying for this loan to invest in more merchandise as her number of customers has increased, and they need items that Lucy cannot currently buy.  Customers choose Lucy because she has low prices and she gives them a month to pay.  This is Lucy's second loan; she paid her first loan back on time.  Lucy chose "Fundación Mujer" because of the good service, the low interest rate and because the organisation operates in Lucy's local area.  Lucy would like to continue with this work because it allows her to earn an income for the household and there are very few jobs in the area.  These last two years have gone very well for Lucy and she wants to continue progressing in her work and to gain more experience and improve as much as she can.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Santiago Benjamin

texts.es: Santiago de 34 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos, el se dedica  a la venta de zapatos y sandalias desde hace varios años en el mercado que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia tiene mucha clientela pues sus productos son de muy buena calidad y a precios realmente accesibles, Santiago esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar  mas mercadería por mayor y asi tener siempre a los clientes satisfechos y pueda obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Santiago, 34, lives with his wife and two children.  He has worked for several years selling shoes and sandals in the market near his place of residence.  He has many customers because his products are very good quality and prices are really affordable.

Santiago is asking for a loan to be able to buy more merchandise at wholesale so his customers will always be satisfied and he can earn higher profits to give his family better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy more shoes at wholesale.

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es: ana de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, Ella posee una tienda donde vende pan, refrescos, aceites, verduras, frutas, golosinas,  jabón y shampoo entre otras cosas tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación desde hace 6 años con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. ana solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir aún más la tienda de manera que pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y de esta misma forma mejorar sus ventas lo cual es su prioridad para sacar adelante su hogar.
texts.en:
Ana, 35 years old, lives with her husband and two children in her own home. She has a store where she sells bread, soft drinks, cooking oil, vegetables, fruit, candy, soap and shampoo, among other items. She has had her store in her home for six years and has used her earnings to pay for household expenses.

Ana is applying for a loan to stock her store so she can better serve her customers. Thus she will be able to improve her sales, which is a priority to help her household get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase bread, soft drinks, cooking oil, vegetables, fruit, candy, soap and shampoo.

loans.name: Fredy Rosbil

texts.es: fredy de 43 años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos en casa propia, el se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas y verduras, fresas, plátanos, naranjas, tomates, cebollas, chiles entre otros tiene 2 años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas, el lugar donde comercia es muy estratégico para la actividad y además muy concurrido de personas, ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefiere porque su producto es fresco, a buen precio, de calidad y con un excelente servicio; fredy es un hombre emprendedor, dedicado a su labor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre está buscando alternativas que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, en las últimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar frutas y verduras por mayor. Fredy tiene buenas referencias de pago, esta agradecido con el apoyo y asegura que podrá saldar la deuda, a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
43-year-old Fredy lives with his life companion and their three children in his own house. He makes a living from the purchase and sale of fruit and vegetables: strawberries, bananas, oranges, tomatoes, onions, chillies, etc. He has had the business for two years and it has given him a lot of experience in sales. The place where he sells is very strategically located and it is a very busy area. He already has many customers who prefer his business because his produce is fresh, reasonably priced, and good quality, and because he provides excellent service. 

Fredy is an enterprising man who is dedicated to his work and he has a great desire to get ahead. He is always looking for alternatives which will allow him to succeed. In recent weeks demand has increased and he wants to take the opportunity to make a new investment but he does not possess enough capital for backing. For this reason he is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so he can purchase fruit and vegetables wholesale. Fredy has good credit references. He is grateful for the support and he says he will be able to settle the debt. He trusts that the loan will give his family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica a cultivar la tierra.  Con mucha dedicación cultiva maíz y sorgo, lo cual le permite llevar el  pan de cada día a su hogar. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, honrado y responsable. Junto a su compañera de vida trabajan muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia. Gracias a los conocimientos en la agricultura es como logra llevar el sustento a su hogar, que es su principal fuente de ingresos, dado que es la única forma que conoce para ganarse la vida honradamente.  Con muchos deseos de superación se acerco a esta institución para solicitar crédito ya que la temporada para la siembra comenzó y es necesario iniciar la siembra lo antes posible. Esta es la razón por la cual solicita el crédito ya que necesita invertir en la compra de los insumos agrícolas necesarios como: semillas, abonos, insecticidas, etc. para la siembra. el cliente Confía en Dios y en su trabajo que de esta forma logrará  tener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá acceder a una mejor calidad de vida para él y su familia.
texts.en:
The client lives with his life partner and their two children. He has made a living farming for a long time. With much dedication he farms corn and sorghum (a grain), which allows him to put food on the table for his family. He has a reputation for being a hard worker, honorable, and responsible. Along side his life partner, he works very hard to help his family get ahead. Thanks to the knowledge he has about agriculture he is able to provide for his family, as this is where he received his principal income, and is the only way he knows how to earn money in an honorable way. 

With a strong desire to succeed he has approached this economic institution to request a loan, since it is now planting season and he needs to begin plating as soon as possible. This is why he has requested a loan, to invest in the purchase of necessary agricultural supplies, like: seeds, fertilizer, insecticides, etc. for planting a new crop. He trusts in God and in his work that he will have an abundant harvest which will allow him to have a higher quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy slippers and fish

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen lives in Likoni, Kenya. He is married and blessed with a month-old baby. 

Stephen sells motor insurance. He contracts with insurance companies then he finds customers for them. He has done this for the last one year. 

He is trying to set up his own office and he seeks a loan of KES 62,700 (Kenya shillings) to buy office equipment (i.e., a desk, chairs, computers).

He heard of Milango Financial Services from friends and he decided to join, so as to access credit, to be able to grow his company. He wants to create a lot of opportunities for the young people in the society who do not have jobs. The challenge has been the instability in the market.

loans.use: to buy office equipment (i.e., a desk, chairs, computers).

loans.name: Buvsara

texts.ru: Бувсара кредитуется во второй раз. Она имеет хорошую кредитную историю, так как она честная и добросовестная женщина. Бувсаре 46 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Ее муж трудовой мигрант, так как он не смог найти подходящею работу у себя на родине. Бувсара еще в родительском доме научилась сшить национальные женские платья. Она с большим интересом шьёт платья, так как это ее любимое дело. Бувсаре ее ремесло пригодилось, потому что после того как она вышла замуж доход ее мужа не хватал для обеспечения семьи. Она упорно работает для того чтобы обеспечить своих детей со всеми не обходимыми средствами. Бувсара имеет земельный участок, где она начала постройку нового дома для своей семьи. Она данное время не имеет денег для того, чтобы достроить дом. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США для покупки строительных материалов, как цемент, песок, древесина и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту и обещает погасить займ во время.
texts.en: This is Buvsara's second loan from us.  She has a good credit history, since she is an honest and responsible woman.  Buvsara is 46 years old and she is married with four children at home.  Her husband is a migrant worker because he couldn't find suitable work in his own country.  While she was still living in her childhood home, Buvsara began to sew women's national costumes.  She sews dresses with a great deal of interest - it is her favorite thing to do.  Buvsara's craft has come in handy because after she got married, her husband's income was not enough to support the family.  She works hard to provide for her children.  She has a plot of land where she has started building a new home for her family.  At the moment, she doesn't have enough money to finish the construction of the home.  She is asking for a loan of 3,000 US dollars to buy building materials like cement, sand, wood, etc.  She is awaiting your kindness and promises to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: To buy building materials like cement, soil and wood to build her house

loans.name: Gulniso

texts.ru: Гулнисо жизнерадостная и мотивированная женщина. Ей 33 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Детям, старшему 6 и младшему 1 года. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Он там работает и отправляет деньги для жены и детей, чтобы они могли купить не обходимые средства для проживания. Гулнисо более 15 лет работает в школе учительницей. Гулнисо после работы занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры, так как она нуждается в деньгах и живет бедно. Гулнисо посоветовалась с мужем поступить в университет за вторым образованием, и ее муж всесторонне поддержал ее. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для оплаты учебного договора в университет, так как она является студентом в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulniso is an enthusiastic and motivated woman.  She is 33 years old and she is married with two children at home.  Her eldest child is six and her youngest child is one year old.  Gulniso's husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation.  He works there and sends money to his wife and children so they can buy the things they need.  For more than 15 years, Gulniso has been working as a school teacher.  When she is not working, she grows crops because she is poor and needs the money.  She consulted with her husband about going to university for a second degree and he supported her.  She is asking for a loan of 3,000 somoni to pay for her university tuition, as she is a student there.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her tuition

loans.name: Joseph

texts.ru:
Иосиф – из Виноградово. Он – пенсионер по инвалидности общего заболевания, инвалидность 2-ой группы. Иосиф живет в доме со своим сыном, жена у него умерла, дочь вышла замуж.
Сумма в 5 000 гривен понадобилась Иосифу для того, чтобы сделать ремонт в доме, а именно он планирует поменять 2 окна, утеплить стены фасада дома пенопластом и приобрести домой новый холодильник.
texts.en: Joseph is from Vinogradovo.  He is a pensioner on the disability register (2nd group).  Joseph lives at home with his son; his wife has passed away and his daughter is married.  He needs 5,000 hryvnas to make repairs to his home, specifically to replace two windows, to insulate the walls of his home's facade with styrofoam, and to bring home a new refrigerator.

loans.use: to make repairs on his home, specifically to replace two windows, to insulate the walls of his home's facade with styrofoam, and to bring home a new refrigerator.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: Don José de 59 años de edad  es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador, actualmente vive junto a su esposa, el se dedica a ser agricultor siembra todos los años los principales granos básicos de la zona como lo son, maíz y fríjol. Don José desea incrementar sus ventas por eso solicita un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: At 59 years old, Mr. José is a very responsible and hardworking man. He lives together with his wife. Mr. José works in agriculture. Every year he plants basic grains of his area like corn and beans. Mr. José wants to increase his sales, so he is requesting a loan that will allow him to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers, and pesticides, among others. He hopes he can count on the requested loan because he has no other income. With the loan, he will be able to keep bringing bread to his home each without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers, and pesticides among others.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.es:
Melissa tiene 24 años. Ella es estudiante Universitaria de Ingeniería Alimentaria
Melissa estudia esta carrera porque siempre se ha interesado por esta rama, cursa el último año de estudios  y a pesar de algunos obstáculos en cuanto a la información de su carrera continua estudiando. Melissa le dedica a sus estudios de 9 a 10 horas diarias, quiere especializarse en control de calidad de alimentos y llevar otros cursos de especialización como el idioma ingles, mas adelante quiere preparar su tesis y lograr un diplomado. Todo su esfuerzo es con el único fin de convertirse en una buena profesional y ayudar a sus padres que confían en ella. Melissa se siente muy agradecida por este préstamo porque gracias a él podrá pagar su curso de ingles. También quiere agradecer a los inversionistas de KIVA que confían en ella y en muchos jóvenes.
texts.en:
Melissa is 24 years old and studying Food Science at university.  She chose to follow this degree course because it is an area of study in which she has always been interested.  Right now, she is in her final year and, in spite of some difficulties with the content of her course, she continues studying.  

Melissa dedicates around 9 to 10 hours a day to her studies and would like to specialize in quality control and take some other specialization courses such as English language.  In the future, she wants to prepare her dissertation and gain her degree.  She makes all this effort with the sole aim of becoming a good professional and helping her parents who have placed their trust in her.  Melissa feels very grateful for this loan because it will enable her to pay for her English course.  She would like to thank Kiva lenders for placing their trust in her and in many other young people.

loans.use: to pay for an English course

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Fanta from Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. She is married with 3 children who are between the ages of 4 and 10 years. Two of her children are currently attending school. In 2009, Fanta established her general stock business. She was a housewife but she needed to create income to support the home and improve her standard of living. She works at the business 15 hours a day, 7 days a week. She says that the main challenge to her business transportation and price inflation.

Fanta requires a loan in order to buy more soft drinks, soap, milk, tooth paste and sardines. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to take good care of her family. In the future, Fanta plans to build a permanent residence for her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, soap, milk, tooth paste and sardines.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is 35 years old and married with 2 children, aged 12 and 20 years. She runs a fish business in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. She started this business to get her daily living. Her husband is a fisherman, but his income is not enough to support the home.

She has been in this business since just after she got married and sells fish within her community. She says that at present her business is doing well because out of the profit she was able to make for her family.

Kadiatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more fish to resell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, she would like to expand her business more than ever. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.name: Rahimzhon

texts.ru:
Рахимжон, человек с доброй душой. Он живет в горном Таджикистане и гордится своей страной. Рахимжон более 25 лет занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры. В основном он выращивает арбуз. Полученный доход он продает на рынке. Он старается обеспечить своих клиентов со сладкими и вкусными арбузами. Он имеет своих постоянных клиентов.
У него большая семья. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Его жена и дети помогают ему введение бизнеса. Выращивание и продажа арбуза является основным источником дохода такой большой семьи. 
Он запрашивает займ, чтобы купить минеральные удобрения. Доход, который он будет получать от бизнеса, будет использовать для образования своих детей и улучшения условия жизни. Он нуждается и ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Rahimzhon is a man with a good soul.  He lives in the mountains of Tajikistan and he is proud of his country.  For more than 25 years, Rahimzhon has worked in agriculture.  He mainly grows watermelons, which he sells at the market.  He strives to provide his clients with sweet and tasty watermelons, and he has regular customers.  Rahimzhon has a large family.  He is married with four children at home, and his wife and children help him with his business.  Growing and selling watermelons is the main source of income for this large family.  He is asking for a loan to buy mineral fertilizer.  He will use the income from the business to pay for his children's education and to improve their living conditions.  He needs and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers for a plot where he grows watermelon

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru:
Ирина живет в городе Мелитополе. Она торгует женской одеждой на крупном местном рынке. Ирина занимается этим бизнесом уже 7 лет. 
Ирина обратилась к КИВА за суммой в размере 8 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить партию товара, а именно юбки, брюки, блузы, сарафаны и платья под реализацию. Ирина планирует вложить полученную прибыль в последовательное развитие бизнеса, постепенно  улучшая и быт своей семьи.
texts.en: Irina lives in the city of Melitopol.  She sells women's clothes at a large local market and she has been in this line of work for seven years.  She has turned to Kiva for a loan of 8,000 hryvnas to buy a selection of wholesale goods, specifically skirts, trousers, blouses, jumpers and dresses.  She plans to reinvest the money back into her business and to gradually improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a selection of wholesale goods, specifically skirts, trousers, blouses, jumpers and dresses.

loans.name: Mundia

texts.en:
Mundia continues in his quest to expand his mobile money transfer business and become the biggest mobile money agent in the western province of Zambia. He has opened eight mobile money transfer shops in seven districts and continues to grow. This is Mundia’s third Kiva loan. He has repaid his first loan and is currently repaying his second one very quickly. 

Mundia has requested another loan so that he can purchase a trading booth that he will use to operate his newest shop. He explains that paying rentals for an existing shop every month is a heavy burden for his business. By purchasing a trading booth, he only has to pay ground rates to the city councils, thereby increasing his profit. He will also use the loan to add to his working capital, so he can serve his customers faster; he won't have to keep moving money from one shop to another in order to help his customers. 

Mundia says he is eternally grateful for the support he received from the Kiva lenders. He now earns more profits, helping him to take care of his family and keep re-investing in his business. Mundia’s face lights up when he explains that he was able to pay for his son’s wedding last month. He is also excited that two of his children are completing their high school this year. 

Mundia thanks the Kiva lenders for their support and looks forward to more engagement with them through his updates.

loans.use: to purchase a trading booth for his newest mobile money transfer shop and add to its working capital.

loans.name: Charo

texts.en:
Charo lives in Kaloleni near Mariakani Kenya. Charo is married and blessed with six children. He operates a food cafeteria. He started this business from selling palm wine. Then the income is what led to opening this viable venture.

Charo, 33, knew of Milango through friends, and with a need of accessing credit, he decided to join. He now seeks a loan of 10,650 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, rice, maize flour, cooking oil and some mugs for serving his customers. In the next five years, Charo says, he will have a wholesale shop to accompany this business.

The money raised from the loan will pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, maize flour, cooking oil and some mugs.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George, his wife and their three school-going children live in Kongowea, Kenya. He has been selling secondhand clothes for the last thirteen years. He learned of Milango from his friends and now seeks a loan of 73,050 KES to buy ladies' shoes and an additional five bales of secondhand clothes. The major challenge he faces is inflation and price fluctuation. He wants to own a large warehouse supplying clothes and ladies' shoes, in five years. The income raised from the loan will improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy ladies' shoes and an additional five bales of secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Norberto

texts.es: Norberto es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, es muy trabajador, se dedica a ser agricultor siembra maíz y fríjol cuando su cosecha ya ha pasado se dedica a trabajar de jornal en una finca que está cerca de su casa vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus 3 hijos. Norberto desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso solicita un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Norberto is a very responsible man when it comes to his household duties.  He is a very hard-working farmer who grows corn and beans.  When he has harvested his own crops he works as a day laborer on another farm near his home.  Norberto lives in his own house together with his wife and three children.  He would like to increase his sales and is requesting a loan that will allow him to buy seeds, compost, fertilizers, pesticides, etc.  He hopes to be able to count on the help he has requested as this is his only source of income.  The loan will enable him to continue providing for his household without limitations.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, fertilizers, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.es: Eufemia con su anterior credikiva compró ropa, calzado, perfumes, colonias, accesorios y electrodomésticos menores. Con el aumento de su volumen de compras, gracias a KIVA su negocio creció sus utilidades aumentaron y está feliz pues logró conseguirle empleo de mesera a su hija menor. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “ Gracias por la ayuda recibida. Deseo para ustedes y sus familiares salud y prosperidad.” En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento con el cual comprará mercancía como ropa, calzado, perfumes, colonias, accesorios, cosméticos y electrodomésticos pequeños como licuadoras, abanicos ollas arroceras, las cuales las comprará basada en los pedidos de su clientela, haciendo de su credikiva una exitosa inversión.
texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan, Eufemia bought clothing, shoes, perfumes, colognes, accessories, and small appliances. With the increase in her purchase volume, thanks to Kiva, her business has grown and her profits have increased. She is happy because she managed to get a waitress job for her youngest daughter. 

Eufemia's message to the Kiva lenders is as follows: "Thank you for the help I received. I wish for health and prosperity for you and your relatives."

She is currently applying for a new loan with which she will buy merchandise like clothing, shoes, perfumes, colognes, accessories, cosmetics, and small appliances like blenders, fans, and rice cookers. She will buy them based on her customers' orders, making her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise like clothing, shoes, perfumes, colognes, accessories, cosmetics, and small appliances like blenders, fans, and rice cookers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of gari, groundnuts, and biscuits, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Zarah Jane

texts.en:
Zarah Jane works hard to support her family. Zarah Jane is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

Zarah Jane requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of ingredients for her business.

Zarah Jane has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Zarah Jane would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is a 60-years-old, married woman with 3 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Loreta has a business of buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines. Loreta requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

Loreta has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Loreta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn by quintals [100 lbs], chicharrón [fried pork rinds], beans, quesillo [soft white cheese], tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Emerita Alicia

texts.es: Emerita de 47 años de edad, vive con esposo y sus cuatro hijos en casa propia, La señora es una mujer trabajadora, responsable y muy emprendedora. Desde hace varios años se dedica a la  producción y venta de productos lácteos en la zona donde reside también posee un molino desde hace varios años tiene mucha clientela principalmente las señoras que elaboran tortillas pues ahi llegan a moler el maiz para elaborarlas, ya que ella es una persona muy amable y responsable, doña ermita solicita un credito para poder comprar cuchillas, discos y todas las herramientas necesarias para tener un buen molino y asi seguir con su trabajo para darles el sustento diario a su familia sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en:
Emerita, age 47, lives with her husband and their four children in her own house.  She is a hard-working, responsible, and very enterprising woman.  For several years she has been producing and selling dairy products in the area where she lives.  She also has had a mill for several years.  She has a lot of clientele, mostly the women who make tortillas.  They come here to grind the corn to make them.  She is a very kind and responsible person.

Emerita is requesting a loan to be able to buy blades, discs, and all of the tools needed to have a good mill.  This way she will continue with her work in order to give her family its daily sustenance without any limitation.

loans.use: to buy blades, discs, and other tools.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 44 years old and married with five children.

Elsa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

Elsa has borrowed and repaid nineteen loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for eight years and also earns an income from buying and selling nipa, woven palm mats used for house repair and construction.

Elsa aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Florintina

texts.es:
Florentina nació en la comunidad de Pumapaccha y vive en la misma comunidad donde nació, ella tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y tiene cinco hijos, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo. Su actividad económica principal es la elaboración de artesanía de tipo de tejido como por ejemplo chalinas, chulos, mantas. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Tahuantinsuyo” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar lana de alpaca, llama y oveja.  

(La comunidad de Pumapaccha pertenece al distrito de Colquepata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Florentina was born in the Pumapaccha community, and she lives in the same community where she was born.  She is 40 years old, married, and has five children.  She is a hard-working and enterprising person who gets ahead with much effort and work.  Her main business activity is hand making woven goods like scarves, hats, and blankets.  She has belonged to the Tahuantinsuyo communal bank for several years.

She now needs a loan to buy alpaca, llama, and sheep’s wool.

(The Pumpacca community is in the Colquepata district, Paucartambo province, Cusco department, Peru.)

loans.use: to buy alpaca, llama, and sheep’s wool.

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en:
Rose Marie works hard to support her family. Rose Marie is married and has a jeepney transport business in the Philippines. Rose Marie has been in this business for 13 years now.

Rose Marie requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts, paint, and other equipment for the maintenance of her jeepney.

In the future, Rose Marie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, paint, and other equipment for the maintenance of her jeepney.

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia is 51 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Clemencia has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Clemencia requested a PHP 19500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Clemencia has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Clemencia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Jane works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from her buy-and-sell purified water business and restaurant. 

Jane is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing equipment for her fishing business.

Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing equipment.

loans.name: Estrellitas Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres empresarias una de ellas es Elizabeth es una mujer de 30 años de edad, acompañada, tiene cuatro hijos de 14, 11,7, y 3 años respectivamente, tiene siete años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa nueva, zapatos, sandalias, cosméticos de la Avon ya que anteriormente viajaba al país vecino de Costarica a comercializar sus productos, actualmente comercia sus productos en nuestra  capital, tiene tres años de ser cliente de la institución paga puntual sus préstamos , el crédito lo  invertirá en la compra de ropa como pantalón de varón, pantalón de dama, camisas de varón, blusas, chores, cosméticos como cremas para manos, cremas para pies, cremas faciales, perfume de varon,perfume de dama, lociones para cuerpo etc. Luvi tiene 31 años de edad su negocio es la venta de colchones, almohadas, cobertores y Nohemí tiene 21 años de edad su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva, y ropa usada, chinelas y zapatos.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three businesswomen. One of them is Elizabeth; she is a 30-year-old woman who is married and has four children who are 14, 11, 7, and 3 years old. She has been selling new clothes, shoes, sandals, and Avon cosmetics for seven years. Previously she traveled to the neighboring country of Costa Rica to sell her products; currently, she sells her products in the Nicaraguan capital. 

Elizabeth has been a client of the institution for three years and pays her loans punctually. She will invest this loan in the purchase of clothing like men's pants, women's pants, men's shirts, blouses, shorts, and cosmetics like hand creams, foot creams, face creams, men's cologne, women's perfume, body lotions, etc. 

Luvi is 31 years old and her business is selling cushions, pillows, and bedspreads.

Nohemí is 21 years old and her business is selling new clothes, used clothes, sandals, and shoes.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of clothing like men's pants, women's pants, men's shirts, blouses, shorts and Avon cosmetics like hand creams, foot creams, face creams, men's cologne, women's perfume, body lotions, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: obtain professional counselling for business design and creation.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena is 53 years old and married with six children. Azucena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, sugar, milk, and canned goods.

Azucena has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Azucena aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, sugar, milk, and canned goods.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Nora has been in this business for 5 years. Nora earns more income from her general store.

Nora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Fretzi

texts.en:
Fretzi is a 38-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has two children, ages 14 and 15 years old respectively. She runs a retail store. She sells goods such as noodles, canned goods, vinegar, powdered milk, coffee and detergents. 

She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy additional goods like condiments, beverages and dry goods for the customers to have a variety of stock to choose from.

In the future, Fretzi would like to expand her business to augment her income and save some of the profits to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional goods like condiments, beverages and dry goods.

loans.name: Maria Hilda

texts.es: Doña Maria se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años su principal siembra es el maíz y el maicillo con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos, doña Maria está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar herbicidas, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, etc. para seguir con sus cosechas y poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Maria has been working in farming for several years.  Her main crops are corn and millet.  With the profits she makes, she is able to cover her household expenses.  She lives in her own house with her husband and their children.

Maria is asking for this loan in order to buy herbicide, fertilizer, manure, seeds, and other things so she can continue harvesting and be able to give her family greater financial stability.

loans.use: buy herbicide, fertilizer, manure, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Giovanni

texts.es:
Giovanni es hombre dedicado a su familia y apasionado a su trabajo, desde hace más de 15 años aprendió el oficio de mecánica empleándose en un taller. Hoy busca la forma de independizarse y crear su propio negocio con el fin de mejorar su condición económica y garantizarles a sus tres hijos una mejor calidad de vida y una buena educación. Razón por la cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de repuestos, lubricantes y herramientas.
El taller lo abrirá en un pequeño garaje de propiedad familiar, por lo cual tendrá mejores rendimientos. Sueña con posicionar su negocio y convertirlo en el mejor de su localidad. Asegura que el bienestar de su familia es lo más importante por lo cual trabajará fuertemente para garantizarcelo.
texts.en:
Giovanni is a man who's dedicated to his family and passionate about his work. Over 15 years ago he learned the trade of auto mechanics by working for a repair shop. Today he seeks to become independent and start his own business so that he can improve his financial situation and ensure better living conditions and a good education for his children. That's why he's requesting a loan which he'll use to purchase spare parts, lubricants and tools.
He will set up the shop in a small garage his family owns, which will result in better profits. He dreams of establishing his business and turning it into the best shop in town. He guarantees that his family's well-being is the most important thing, which is why he'll work very hard in order to ensure it.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts, lubricants and tools.

loans.name: Katrina

texts.en:
As a  parent of two children, Katrina works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Katrina is borrowing PHP 24000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of fish to sell for her business.

Katrina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of fish to sell.

loans.name: Hayde

texts.en:
Hayde is a 27-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has three young children, ages 2, 3 and 4 months old respectively. She is engaged in a fish vending business. Her husband is a fisherman. She sells fish to customers in the community. She and her husband work hard to earn a living. 

She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fishing materials like fishing net, lift weights and floaters,to gain more catch. 

In the future, Hayde would like to augment her business to provide her family with good food and to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net, lift weights and floaters.

loans.name: Everlides

texts.es: Everlides de 49 años de edad, es una mujer echada para adelante que tiene claro que el bienestar de sus hijos es lo más importante, por lo cual se ha convertido en su mayor reto. Desde hace 30 años, labora en la plaza de mercado de su localidad, como ayudante y desde hace algún tiempo logró adquirir un puesto en la plaza e independizarse. Labora diariamente comercializando frutas y verduras, actividad que le permite generar los recursos para el sostenimiento de su familia. Con el fin de aumentar las ventas, se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido. Sueña con mejorar la calidad de vida de su hogar y tener una mejor condición económica.
texts.en:
Everlides is 49 years old and is determined woman who has made the well-being of her children (which she believes is of the greatest importance) her top priority.  She has worked in the town market for 30 years, starting out as an assistant.  Some time ago, she was able to gain her own spot in the plaza and start her own business.  She works every day selling fruit and vegetables and this allows her to help provide for her family.

With the goal of increasing her profits, she is asking for a loan that she will use to stock up on goods.  She dreams of improving the quality of life in her home and having greater financial stability.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 31 years old and lives in Highway Lawis, Panalsalan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has no children. 

Ruth has a pig raising business and earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to pay for a sack of feed.

Ruth has been a member of PMPC since just 1 month ago. In the future, Ruth hopes to have enough savings for additional capital in her business.

loans.use: to pay for a sack of feed.

loans.name: Lorlain

texts.en:
This 46-year old mother with three children is from San Vicente Alto, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is Lorlain, who runs a "sari-sari" (general) store that sells a variety of products. She supports her family with this business. 

She is applying for a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy additional inventory for sale. She sees the high demand at the store. 

Lorlain deeply wishes to repay her obligations in a timely fashion. She dreams to own a house and lot someday.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory for sale.
