En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una vaca lechera con el fin de aumentar la producción de leche, aumentando sus ingresos y mejorando las condiciones de vida de su familia. A futuro Gloria desea aumentar el número de animales y tecnificar el proceso de lechería
texts.en:
Gloria is a farmer from the rural area of Marinilla, Colombia.  She works in agriculture, specifically buying cattle and selling milk.  She has been working in this business for a number of years with the aim of making income and helping her husband with their household expenses and their 4-year-old son's education.

Gloria is currently requesting a loan to invest in buying a dairy cow so that she can increase her milk production, increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.  In the future, she would like to increase the number of animals she has and employ technology in her milking process.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Renan

texts.es:
Renan es un hombre de 38 años, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el distrito de Guadalupe con su esposa y sus dos hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con sus esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Renan no pudo culminar sus estudios primarios y eso lo imposibilito a estudiar la carrera profesional de Veterinaria que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse viendo televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Tallarines Rojos para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Renan se dedica a la agricultura, el cuenta con una pequeña parcela donde siembra yuca, el trabaja todos los días realizando laboreas de campo, adicionalmente también brinda servicios de arado en otras parcelas, Renan trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su experiencia y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Renan se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de riego, abono y cosecha de su cultivo de yuca, de esta manera Renan podrá asegurar el crecimiento adecuado de su cosecha, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ampliar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Renan is a 38-year-old man who lives in the city of Chiclayo, in Guadalupe district, with his wife and two children who he loves and who are his main focus in life.  Renan is a very friendly, hard-working, enthusiastic person who, together with his wife, puts all his efforts into providing for his family.  Unfortunately, owing to a lack of financial resources and the need to work from a very young age in order to help his family, Renan was unable to complete his primary education which made it impossible for him to study for a degree in Veterinary Medicine as he would have liked to have done.  In his free time, Renan enjoys relaxing by watching television and he sometimes cooks a delicious 'tallarines rojos' (spaghetti with tomato sauce) to share with his family.

On his own initiative, and with a lot of determination and dedication, Renan works as a farmer.  He has a small plot of land where he grows cassava.  He carries out his farm work every day and, in addition, he also provides plowing services on other people's land.  Renan works for approximately 10 hours every day and believes that he is doing well because of his experience and the kind way he treats others.

Renan is very grateful to Kiva lenders as, thanks to their help, he will be able to cover the cost of irrigating, fertilizing and harvesting his cassava crops.  This will allow him to ensure the suitable growth of his crops and he will be able to continue working hard to realize his dream of expanding the crops he grows.

loans.use: to cover the cost of irrigating, fertilizing and harvesting his crops

loans.name: Dino

texts.en:
Dino lives with his wife and child. He is a hog raiser from Sto.Domingo. He fattens and breeds them for sale upon achieving the desired weight. He has been in his business for over five years now. 

Dino would like to keep making his business profitable so he is now asking for additional capital of PHP 35,000 to buy five sacks of feeds, medicines and vaccines for hogs. He hopes to continuously give nourishment to his hogs so he will sell them at higher prices and earn more income, which will lead to financial stability someday.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of feeds, medicines and vaccines for hogs.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Marilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. 

Marilyn is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is a married woman who has two children.

She earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place.  

Belen is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, candies, soda, soap and toiletries, cooking ingredients and others. Through this loan, she will be able to improve her store and cater to more customers.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, candies, soda, soap and toiletries, cooking ingredients and others.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a pottery business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from variety store. Gemma is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her pottery business.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her pottery business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 36 years old, married, and has two children.

Helen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like detergent, soap, snack foods and other groceries.

Helen has been in this business for seven years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Helen aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like detergent, soap, snack foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo es un joven de 24 años de edad, quien ha residido en el campo toda su vida, aprendió del oficio agrícola y agropecuario, conocimientos que hoy desea aprovechar para la creación de su propia unidad productiva. Desea invertir en la compra de cerdos, ya que considera que es uno de los negocios más rentables en su localidad. Para cumplir su propósito se encuentra solicitando un crédito ya que no cuenta con recursos propios para iniciar con su proyecto de empresa.
Sueña con garantizarle a sus padres mejores condiciones de vida y la oportunidad de gozar de una vejez digna.
texts.en:
Pablo is a young 24 years old and he has resided in the countryside his entire life.  He learned agricultural work and now wants to apply his knowledge and start his own agricultural business. He wants to invest in the purchase of pigs because it is considered one of the most profitable businesses in the region.  In order to make this dream come true, he is seeking a loan because he doesn't have resources to begin the business on his own.  

He dreams to provide his parents with better living conditions and the opportunity to enjoy their old age with dignity.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Kowkeb

texts.en:
Kowkeb, 31 years old, is a married woman and the mother of two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Sanaa, Yemen. She is a housewife, and her husband has a small grocery. 

In the last years, they have accumulated a small amount of money to start building their own house, but it is not enough. Therefore, she applied for a 100,000 YER loan to buy doors and painting to finish construction. Kowkeb looks forward to building another roof.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing construction supplies.

loans.name: Anelyn

texts.en:
Anelyn works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising ducks in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from jeepney transport and rice retailing businesses. 

Anelyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her ducks.

Anelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her ducks.

loans.name: Allan James

texts.en:
Allan James is 33 years old and single. He lives in a rural community with his beloved parents. Due to hardship of living, he is engaged in a hog-raising business to generate additional income. He aims to improve the business and make it profitable in order to generate sufficient income to satisfy their needs and support his parents. 

Due to inadequate capital, he is asking for an additional capital of PHP 15,000 to buy the needed feeds, vitamins and vaccines for the maintenance of his hogs. Through hard work and strong determination, he believes that he will improve the business, and he hopes that someday, he will become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy the needed feeds, vitamins and vaccines for his hogs.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en:
Agripina is a coconut farmer from the town of Sikatuna, Bohol. 

She has been in the coconut farming business for more than 15 years now. This is the source of her income. 

Agripina is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the coconut trees. With this, she will be able to improve her farm and augment her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the coconut trees.

loans.name: Nanci Miguelina

texts.es:
Nanci nació en la comunidad de Pumapaccha y vive en la misma comunidad donde nació, ella tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo. Sus actividades económicas son la elaboración de artesanía de tipo tejido como por ejemplo elabora chalinas, chulos, mantas y la venta de coca. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Tahuantinsuyo” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar lana de alpaca y oveja. 

(La comunidad de Pumapaccha pertenece al distrito de Colquepata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Nanci was born in the community of Pumapaccha and lives in the same community where she was born.  She is 19 years old and single. She is a hardworking and enterprising person who is getting ahead with a lot of effort and hard work.  Her economic activities are the making of woven handicrafts like scarves, hats and blankets and the sale of coca leaves.  For several years she has belonged to the communal bank “Tahuantinsuyo” and on this occasion she needs the loan to purchase alpaca and sheep's wool.

(The community of Pumapaccha belongs to the district of Colquepata in the province of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco, Perú).

loans.use: to purchase alpaca and sheep's wool.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Santiago de 22 años de edad, es un joven emprendedor, que ha laborado en la salsamentaria de su padre desde hace algunos años, oficio que le ha permitido adquirir el conocimiento sobre administración y compras. Hoy desea crear su propio negocio por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido-licor- y adecuaciones locativas.  Sueña con ser independiente y generar los ingresos necesarios para solventar sus gastos y pagar sus estudios universitarios. Asegura que este es uno de los mayores retos que ha afrontado en toda su vida, pero está convencido que con la experiencia y la asesoría de su familia logrará que su negocio sea perdurable en el tiempo.
texts.en:
Santiago is twenty-two years old and is an enterprising young man.  He has worked at his father's deli for several years, a position that has allowed him to acquire knowledge about administration and purchasing.  

Today, he wishes to create his own business, which is why he is requesting a loan.  He will invest in the purchase of liquor supplies and upgrading his business premises.  He dreams of being independent and generating the necessary income in order to cover his expenses and to pay for his university studies.

He says that this is one of the greatest challenges that he has faced in his life, but he is convinced that with the experience and advice of his family, his business will be around for a long time.

loans.use: to buy a liquor supply.

loans.name: Gerber Anibal

texts.es: Don Gerber de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, fríjol desde hace 27 años y eso le ha dado la experiencia necesaria para asistir sus cultivos, sus cosechas las comercializa en los mercados de granaos básicos con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Don gerber solicita un credito para poder mejorar el terreno donde piensa hacer su siembra y comprar los insumos necesarios como fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos, entre otras cosas para tener buenas cosechas y asi el pueda obtener  mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica
texts.en:
Gerber, 46 years old, lives in his own house with his wife and daughter.  He has made a living cultivating corn and beans for 27 years and that has given him the experience necessary to attend to his crops.  He sells his harvests in the basic grains markets.  With the earnings that he obtains from his sales he manages to cover the household expenses.  

Gerber is requesting a loan to be able to improve the land he intends to plant and to buy the necessary supplies like fertilizers, herbicides and manure among other things in order to have good harvests.  In this way he can obtain better earnings in order to give his family better financial stability.

loans.use: to improve the land and to buy fertilizers, herbicides, manure, etc.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Juanita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pottery business in the Philippines. She is requesting her second loan from NWTF for 18,000 PHP, which she will use to buy raw materials for her pottery business. Juanita's income helps to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her pottery business.

loans.name: Librada

texts.en: Librada earns a living through her hog raising and cow raising business. She lives in the town of Sikatuna, Bohol. This is the source of her income. Librada is asking for a loan to buy more piglets and a cow to raise. With this, she will be able to improve her ventures as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and a cow to raise

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling shoes in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase more shoes and clothing to sell.  Mely successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Mely's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Handia Group

texts.en:
Handia is a group of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They have requested a loan in the amount of 160,000 YER to buy home appliances. 
Soad, 29 years-old, is the leader of the group. She is an educated married woman and the mother of a child. She lives with her family in a small house in Sana'a. Her husband is working very hard to cover the needs of his family, but his monthly salary is not enough to pay for everything. Soad decided to help her husband buy home appliances, so she applied for a 40,000 YER loan to buy a cooker. She hopes that she will be able to buy all home appliances she needs.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing home appliances

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is a scrap and coconut shells buyer from Bohol, Philippines. She goes out to some areas in her town and buys used bottles, papers, plastics, metals, iron roofs, coconut shells and other scrap materials. She sells all of them to a main buyer, and she earns enough money for her family's needs. Aida is now asking for additional capital for her business. She is asking for a loan worth 15,000PHP to buy more scraps, and coconut shells to sell. With this, she will be able to improve her business as well as her income. In the future, Aida hopes to make her business a success and a stable source of her income.

loans.use: to buy more scraps, and coconut shells to sell

loans.name: Roche

texts.en:
Roche is a coconut farmer from the town of Sikatuna, Bohol. She also runs a sari-sari or variety store selling various goods and items to the people in  her place.
Roche is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the farm and additional stock to sell, like canned goods, candies, soda, soap and beverages. With this, she will be able to improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the farm and additional stock to sell, like canned goods, candies, soda, soap and beverages

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is a coconut farmer from Antequera, Bohol. She is a married woman and has two children.

Concepcion is asking for a loan, which she will use to buy fertilizer for the farm. With the fertilizer, she will be able to produce a bigger harvest from her coconut farm, thus augmenting her income and savings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the coconut farm

loans.name: Nelpha

texts.en:
Nelpha earns a living through her hog raising business. She lives with her family in Antequera, Bohol. 

Nelpha is asking for a loan to buy feed for the pigs. Through this purchase, she will be able to improve her business as well as her income. Nelpha dreams of expanding her business so that it will generate more revenue for the needs of the family, like food consumption and paying the bills.

loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs

loans.name: Al-Entema'a Group

texts.en:
Al-Entema'a is a group of three poor women from Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a 150,000 YER loan.
 
Taqiah, 57 years old, is an educated married woman and the mother of four children. She lives with her family in a small, old house in Sana'a. The house is very old, and it needs a lot of money for renovation. Her husband has managed to accumulate a decent amount of money, but it is not enough. Taqiah decided to help him and applied for a loan in the amount of 50,000 YER.

She hopes that she will be able to open a savings account after finishing the renovation of her house.

loans.use: to pay for house renovation

loans.name: Al-Azhar Group

texts.en:
Al-Azhar Group consists four women from Al-Hodeida governorate, Yemen. They are requesting a loan for 80,000 YER, which they will use to buy clothes and cosmetics to sell.
 
Latifa is 26 years old, married,  and the leader of the group. Her husband works for many hours every day to cover the expenses of his family. She decided to help him and started a small business. She sells clothes and cosmetics door-to-door,  which she has been doing for one year.  Latifa wants to buy more clothes and cosmetics because the demand is increasing at this time of the year. She is requesting a loan from AMB for 20,000 YER  She looks forward to opening her own clothes store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Sergio Antonio

texts.es: Don Sergio es una persona muy humilde y responsable, vive en casa propia con su familia, es muy trabajador ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a su familia, se dedica a la compra y venta de chatarra o materiales reciclados como plástico, hierro, aluminio, latas, etc. con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene ya que es la forma en que el se gana la vida honradamente, desea incrementar su negocio por lo que decidió acercarse a las oficinas de integral y solicitar un financiamiento para la compra de chatarra lo cual incluye todos los materiales que el cliente vende, espera contar con la ayuda solicitada para poder seguir con su negocio y que no le falte el pan de cada día a su familia.
texts.en:
Sergio is a very humble and responsible person.  He lives in his own home with his family.  He is hardworking, and has always been known to offer the best to his family.

He makes a living in buying and selling scrap metal and recycled materials, like plastic, iron, aluminum, cans, etc.  With the profits that he makes from his sales, he helps with the family expenses.  This is how he is able to make an honorable living.

He hopes to grow his business, and has decided to approach the Integral offices and ask for financing.  He will buy scrap metal of many types of materials from a client.  He hopes to have this requested help in order to be able to continue with his business and to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal wholesale.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a married woman who has four children, and she lives at Antequera, Bohol. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than 10 years. This is the source of her income, and her husband works as a carpenter.

Salome is asking for a loan, which she will use to buy pigs to raise. Salome hopes to expand her business in the future, so that it will generate more income.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a basket weaver, from the town of Antequera, Bohol. She is a married woman and has three children. Gina has been in the basket-weaving business for more than 15 years. This is her main source of income.

Gina is asking for a loan to buy materials for making baskets, like "nito" (a native palm), wicker and others. With this purchase of materials, she will be able to make more baskets. She will sell them to the market for a good price.

loans.use: to buy materials to use in making baskets, like nito, wicker and others

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is a merchant and runs a sari-sari (variety) store, in her place in Bohol, Philippines. Loida has been engaged in the business for more than two years now.

At this time, she needs a loan for her store. She is applying for a loan, which she intends to use to buy inventory for the store, including rice, canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries. With this purchase, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers in her store.

loans.use: to buy more stock to resell at her store, like rice, canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Malekah Group

texts.en:
Malekah is a group of five women from Taiz, Yemen. They applied for a 150,000 Yemeni rial (YER) loan to renovate houses. 
Ashwaq, 23 years old, is a married woman and the mother of one child. She lives with her family in a small, old house in Taiz city. Her house is very old and needs a renovation. Her husband managed to accumulate a decent amount of money, but it is not enough. Ashwaq decided to help him and apply for a loan in the amount of 50,000 YER. She looks forward to having a better and bigger house.

loans.use: to pay for her house renovation

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria nació en la comunidad de Pumapaccha y vive en la misma comunidad donde nació, ella tiene 21 años de edad, tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo. Sus actividades económicas son la elaboración de artesanía de tipo de tejido como por ejemplo chalinas, chulos, mantas y la agricultura, ella tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra papa, hortalizas, lizas, tarwi, entre otras. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Tahuantinsuyo” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes. 

(La comunidad de Pumapaccha pertenece al distrito de Colquepata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Victoria was born in the community of Pumapaccha, where she still lives. She is 21 years old, lives in a common-law marriage and has a child. Victoria is a hardworking and enterprising person that gets ahead with a lot of effort and hard work. She makes handicrafts, more specifically different types of knitting: scarfs, chullos [an Andean style of hat with earflaps] and blankets. She also works in agriculture. She has several pieces of land where she grows different types of potatoes, tarwi [a species of lupine grown in the Andes] and other types of vegetables.

Victoria has been a member of communal bank “Tahuantinsuyo” for some years and is now requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.

(The community of Pumapaccha is located in the Colquepata district, Paucartambo province, in the department of Cusco).

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Bara

texts.fr:
Monsieur Bara fait parti des cinq cent premier clients de cette IMCEC sis au centre du Sénégal, pourtant il vient pour la première fois, solliciter un crédit. Il a toujours fonctionné avec ses moyens propres. Seulement pour cette fois ci, il vient solliciter l’appui de l’IMCEC pour un petit montant de 100000F CFA qui va lui permettre d’acheter de l’engrais et des semences afin de préparer la campagne agricole.
Bara âgé de 31 ans est marié et père de 3 enfants dont il a la charge.
Bara rêve de devenir un grand agriculteur et de cultiver des hectares de terre.
texts.en:
Bara is one of the first 500 customers for this IMCEC branch, located in the center of Senegal. He is applying for his very first loan. Bara has always made do with his own means, and is now seeking the support of IMCEC for a small amount of 100,000 FCFA. This will allow him to buy fertilizer and seeds to prepare for the next agricultural cycle.

Bara is 31 years old and is married with three children, for whom he is responsible. Bara's dreams of becoming a great farmer and cultivating several hectares of land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds to prepare for the next agricultural cycle.

loans.name: Fotemogoban C Group

texts.fr:
Les  7 membres du groupe  Fotemogoban C sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 5 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Kokouna, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution et les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Portio debout au milieu sur la photo, elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Fotemogoban C Group are all married women with an average age of 37, and and average of five children. They are all living in traditional families in Kokouna, one of the villages in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. The group is one their fourth loan with the institution and their prior loans have been repaid in full.

Portio (shown in the photo standing in the center), grows crops of corn. With her ​​loan, she intends to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for the labor cost of maintaining one hectare of farmland. After the harvest, produce is sold in the Sikasso village market to a clientele composed of men and women.

Portio expects to earn an average income of 100,000 FCFA per agricultural cycle. The money she earns will allow her to repay her loan and to help her family pay for their daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for the labor cost of maintaining one hectare of farmland.

loans.name: Fotemogoban B Group

texts.fr:
Les  6 membres du groupe  Fotemogoban B sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 4 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Kokouna, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution et les deux prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs, et  Sanata debout au milieu sur la photo, 
 compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 150.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The six members of the Fotemogoban B group are all married women, on the average 36 years of age, with four children. They all live in traditional families in Kokouna, a village in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better manage their agricultural activities during the winter season.

They are on their fourth loan with Soro Yiriwaso, and their [prior] loans have been duly repaid. The grow corn. Sanata, the one standing in the middle of the photo, plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs [fertilizers etc] and seeds and pay the cost of labor to work 2 ha [about 5 acres]. The produce is sold in the village, at the Sikasso market, to a customer base composed of both men and women. She plans to earn an average revenue of 150,000  West African francs per agricultural cycle. These revenues will allow her to pay of her loan and also help her large family with everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 45 years old and married with three children who are all in school. Rosa works very hard to provide for them.

Rosa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rosa has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, rice and other groceries. 

In the future, Rosa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Clarice

texts.en: Clarice was able to get a first loan that helped her stabilize her business. She is a wife and a mother of five. She came to know Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan of 67,850 Kenya shillings to buy a bag of sugar, 50kg of rice, five bundles of maize flour, 10 crates of sodas and 40 litres of cooking oil. Her major challenge is the high rent that she pays. Income from the loan use will pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy a bag of sugar, 50kg of rice, five bundles of maize flour, 10 crates of sodas and 40 litres of cooking oil

loans.name: Glaisa

texts.en:
Glaisa is 26 years old, married, and has three children who are all in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Glaisa has a general store business in the Philippines. Glaisa requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items like detergent, soap, snack foods and other miscellaneous items.

Glaisa has been in this business for five years. In the future, Glaisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like detergent, soap, snack foods and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a merchant from Loon, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been in the business for more than 22 years now. She sells off-the-rack clothes to the people in her place.

Anita is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like clothes, fashion accessories and others. With this, she will be able to sell more and augment her income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like clothes, fashion accessories and others

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan lives in Kongowea, Kenya. He is married and blessed with two school-going children. 

He sells second-hand clothes at the market in his area. He has been in this business for seven years now. He heard about Milango through friends. He now seeks a loan of 41,850 Kenya shilling to buy used shoes for resale. 

He wants to own his own wholesale store in five years. The challenge he faces is the lack of customers during the low season. He wants his family to have a better life, especially after the loan.

loans.use: to buy a bale of second-hand shoes

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen earns a living through her hog raising business. She is a married woman and a mother of five children. They live in Loon, Bohol. Belen has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years.

Belen is asking for a loan to buy feed for the pigs. With this purchase, she will be able to improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy five bales of second-hand clothes, to resell at the market

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John lives in Mombasa, Kenya. For three years he has been operating a three-wheeled taxi (tuk-tuk). Recently his vehicle broke down and this has stalled his business. 

John learned about Milango through friends and now he seeks a loan of 52,300 Kenya shillings to repair his taxi. He has an ambition of owning a car hire company in five years and this loan will go a long way toward accomplishing that.

The major challenge he faces in this business is the competition from other businesses.

loans.use: To repair/service the vehicle for his public transport business.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a married woman from Loon, Bohol. She earns a living through her retail sales of clothes and fashion accessories. This is the source of her income. 

Arlene is asking for a loan  to buy more clothes and fashion accessories. With this, she will be able to sell more and earn more, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and fashion accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Husina

texts.en:
Husina lives in Kongowea, Kenya. She is married and blessed with three school-going children. 

She sells second-hand clothes at the market in her area. She has been in this business for twelve years now. She learned about Milango through friends. She now seeks a loan of 31,450 Kenya shilling to buy five bales of second-hand clothes for resale. 

She wants to own her own wholesale store in five years. The challenges she faces are the lack of customers in the low season and stiff competition from other traders. She wants her family to have a better life, especially after the loan.

loans.use: to buy five bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
She is married with three children and they all live in a four-room apartment in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced some challenges in life  which are: difficulties in her marital life, the death of both parents, sickness of family members, sudden death of friends and relatives, insufficient finances to successfully manage  a business her own, and inability to educate her children.

With this new loan she has requested, she plans to increase her scale of cocoa production by buying more improved seedlings and paying laborers to clear and farm the land. She holds a positive view of the business succeeding because she has experience in the field. She plans to buy improved seedlings and she has regular customers who buy her produce. With this loan activity, the community will have access to enjoy cocoa-related products like chocolate, biscuit, sweets and Ovaltine since her produce will serve as raw materials to the companies producing these products.

With the profit from this loan she will better her children's education, expand her business, save some to cater for ill health, and also construct a house for her family. She prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals, and the training offered at GHAPE.

loans.use: To buy cocoa seedlings, pay for farm clearing, and also buy insecticides

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a vegetable farmer from Bohol, Philippines. She is a married woman and has two children. Alma has been in the farming business for more than 15 years now. This is the source of her income.

Alma is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides. Through this, she will be able to improve her farm as well as her harvest.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Tagoymurod

texts.ru: Тагоймурод живет и работает в городе Душанбе. Ему 54 года. У него жена и шестеро детей. Тагоймурод имеет среднее техническое образование.  Он по профессии шеф-повар. Тагоймурод в городе арендует помещение под кафе и работает там шеф-поваром. Он в этой сфере обслуживания более 20 лет. Тагоймурод является мастером кухонных дел. В списке его меню национальные блюда, супы, гарниры, салаты и многое другое. Тагоймурод готовит вкусно и быстро, и поэтому имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Сейчас он обратился за кредитом, так как у него большая семья и весь его заработанный доход уходит на семейные расходы. Тагоймурод на сумму кредита хочет преобрести большую электрическую духовку в кафе для улучшения процесса выпечки, а на оставшуюся сумму провести ремонт в доме. Он очень любит свое дело и в будущем планирует расширить бизнес и открыть собственную столовую.
texts.en: Tagoymurod lives and works in the city of Dushanbe. He is 54 years old. He has a wife and six children. Tagoymurod has a secondary technical education. He is a chef by profession. Tagoymurod rents accommodations under a café in the city and works there as a chef. He has been in this industry for more than 20 years. Tagoymurod is a culinary expert. He has on his menu national dishes, soups, side dishes, salads, and many other options. Tagoymurod cooks quickly and prepares delicious dishes, which is why he has loyal customers. Now he has applied for a loan, as he has a big family and all of his earned income goes toward family expenses. With the loan amount, Tagoymurod wants to purchase a large, electric oven for his café in order to improve the baking process. With the remainder of the loan, he wants to repair his home. He really loves his profession and in the future, he plans to expand his business and open his own dining hall.

loans.use: to purchase an oven for his café and to repair his home.

loans.name: Moisés Ángel

texts.es: Moisés es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable con los deberes que le corresponde en su hogar, actualmente vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, desde hace varios años se dedica a la  producción y venta de calzado en la zona donde reside. Tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes. Ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus productos, por lo que solicita un crédito para la compra de materia prima para seguir con la elaboración de los zapatos como pega, cuero, suelas, etc. Con esto espera obtener resultados favorables y continuar brindando la ayuda económica a su hogar que tanto lo necesita.
texts.en:
Moisés is a very hard-working man, and he is responsible about his household responsibility.  He currently lives in his own house with his family.  For several years he has been making and selling shoes in the area where he lives.  He has very good clientele because he has known how to win the confidence of his customers.  He offers quality products and good prices.

He is requesting a loan to buy raw materials to continue making shoes.  He will buy things like glue, leather, and soles, etc.  With this he hopes to get favorable results and to continue providing his household with the financial help that it so needs.

loans.use: to buy glue, leather, and soles.

loans.name: Mukum Hilda

texts.en:
This woman is married and has five children, and they all live in a three-bedroom apartment in Bamenda, Northwest Region of Cameroon. She has faced many challenges in life, among which are difficulties faced in her marriage, insufficient financing to successfully manage her business, inability to educate her children, and sickness in her family.

She will invest this new loan, as follows:  she will buy piglets, buy more feed, and construct a fence for the piglets; in addition, she will buy white stuff [palm wine] and food items to prepare and sell in her white stuff house [pub]. She will sell foods like beans and rice. She holds a strong view that this business success is because she has been involved in these lines of this business for a long time and has customers that are regular. The experience she has gained over the past years makes her able to manage the business. With this business activity, the community will have a regular source of palm white for their traditional ceremonial activities, like death celebrations, traditional marriages and birth celebrations. Manure from pig waste will be sold to farmers, for cultivation of crops.

With the profit from this loan, she will educate her children, provide better meals for her family, provide her children with medication, and provide other necessities to her family. She prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: to buy buy piglets, pig feed, and construct a fence for the piglets, and to buy palm wine and food items to prepare and sell

loans.name: Alang

texts.en:
Alang is married with seven children, all above the age of 15. She and her husband live in a five-room apartment in Bamenda, Northwest Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life which include difficulties faced in her marital life, the death of both parents, sickness of family members, the sudden death of friends and relatives, insufficient finances to successfully manage her business, and the inability to educate her children.

Alang has taken and successfully repaid her loans three times and she says that with this new, requested loan, she will buy plastic paper in bulk and store it in her business site. Also, part of the loan will be invested in her clothing business. Alang will buy clothes in town markets and retail them in local markets around the region. 

She believes this business will be successful because she has been involved in this line of business for a long time and has experience in the business. She is very sure to obtain maximum profit from this business. With this business activity, the community will have a regular source of plastic paper of all types. Also, the community will have a good supply of clothing because people will not go a long distance to buy clothes, both for themselves and their children, at moderate price.

With the profit from this loan, Alang will educate her children, provide three square meals to her family, cater for her children's medication, and provide other necessities to her family. She prefers Grounded and Holistic Approach for People's Empowerment (GHAPE) loans because of low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals, and the training offered at GHAPE. Also, the social talks at GHAPE meetings are of interest to her.

loans.use: to buy plastic papers and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is a vegetable farmer from Bohol, Philippines. She is a married and the mother of eight children. She has been in the farming business for more than 20 years, and it is the sole source of her income. Victoria is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides. This will allow her to improve her farm and increase the size of her harvest.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Caren

texts.en: Caren is a vegetable farmer from Bohol, Philippines. She is a married, the mother of three children and has been in the farming business for more than three years. This is her sole source of her income. Caren is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides. This will allow her to improve her farm as well as her harvest.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Faizulo

texts.ru: Файзуло житель города Куляб. Ему 51 год. У него есть жена, две дочери и один сын. Файзуло ответственный и предприимчивый человек. Он намерен начать свой бизнес в сфере услуги такси. У него имеется двухлетий опыт работы в данной сфере. Файзулло выбрал маршрутную линию город Куляб-город Душанбе, так как по этой линии услуга такси всегда массово востребована. Он обратился в ХУМО за кредитом для приобретения автомашины марки OPEL. Он имеет немного сбережения для реализации своей цели, а другую часть запрашивает в заем. Данный кредит поможет Файзулло иметь собственный бизнес и увеличить семейный бюджет.
texts.en: Faizulo is 51 and lives in Kulob. He is married and has two daughters and one son. Faizulo is a responsible and enterprising man and intends to start his own taxi service business. He has worked in this sector for two years and chose the route between Kulob and Dushanbe because of the massive demand for taxis on this route. He asked MLO Humo and Partners for a loan to help him buy an Opel model car. He saved up a bit of money for this goal and will use the loan to cover the rest of the amount. This loan will help Faizulo operate his own business and to increase his family's budget.

loans.use: to purchase a car for taxi services

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
Teresa, tiene 67 años de edad y es madre de un hijo. Considera que el trabajo ha sido su mayor bendición porque gracias a este a podido ofrecerle a su familia lo necesario para vivir.
Cuenta que inició vendiendo productos por catálogo hace más de 15 años y hoy se ha convertido en su actividad económica. 
Con el fin de aumentar su nivel de ventas y poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido al por mayor con el fin de mantener un stock.
Su mayor sueño es montar una tienda dedicada a la venta de sus productos.
texts.en:
Teresa, 67, is the mother of one child.  She thinks her job has been her greatest blessing because she has been able to give her family what they need to live.  She started selling catalogue products more than 15 years ago and now it has become her job.

With the goal of increasing her sales and being able to satisfy customer demand, she's requesting a loan to invest in buying merchandise wholesale so she has enough stock.

Her biggest dream is to set up a store where she can sell her products.

loans.use: to buy beauty and personal care products

loans.name: William De Jesús

texts.es: William de 55 años de edad, es un campesino dedicado a la producción lechera por tradición familiar. Lleva más de 10 años realizando la actividad, la cual le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus tres hijos y brindarles la oportunidad de estudiar. La leche es comercializada a una empresa de lácteos de la región. Con el ánimo de mejorar sus ingresos se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una vaca. Sueña con aumentar su ganado y mejorar la calidad de vida de su grupo familiar.
texts.en: William is a 55-year-old farmer who works in milk production, continuing the family tradition. He has been working in this area for over 10 years, and this has allowed him to provide for his family and give them the opportunity to study. He sells the milk to a dairy company that operates in the area. As he would like to improve his earnings, he has decided to request a loan to buy a cow. He dreams of increasing the quantity of livestock he has and improving his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia is a vegetable farmer from Bohol, Philippines. She is a married woman and has nine children. Alma has been in the farming business for more than 30 years now. This is the source of her income.

Alma is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides. Through this, she will be able to improve her farm as well as her harvest.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a vegetable farmer from Bohol, Philippines. She is a married woman and has seven children. Alma has been in the farming business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of her income.

Alma is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides. Through this, she will be able to improve her farm as well as her harvest.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Bamyong

texts.en:
She is married with four children and they all live in a four-bedroom apartment in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced many challenges in life, among which are sickness in her family, inadequate finances to properly manage her business, death of her loved ones, sickness and accident.

With the new loan requested she will buy palm oil, 'garri' (quick-cooking cassava grits), 'kennel' and beans to expand her foodstuffs business.  She holds a positive view of her business succeeding because she has been doing the business for a long period of time. She has regular customers who buy from her. Her business is situated at a good site and she also supplies in bulk to other retailers in the community.  With this business activity, the community will have regular supply of food items at reduced prices, with discounts also given to regular customers; she will also give credit facilities to customers in times of need.

With the profit from this loan, she will ensure that her family can consume three square meals a day, and cater for other family needs, including the education of her children. To her GHAPE loans are preferable because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals, and members are also trained on business and marketing skills before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, 'garri', 'kennel' and beans.

loans.name: Dioning

texts.en:
Dioning is a vegetable farmer from Bohol, Philippines. She is a married woman and has four children. She has been in the farming business for more than 17 years now. This is the source of her income.

Dioning is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides. Through this loan, she will be able to improve her farm, as well as her harvest.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: Praxedes

texts.en:
Praxedes is a vegetable farmer from Bohol, Philippines. She is a married woman and has five children. She has been in the farming business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of her income.

Praxedes is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides. Through this loan, she will be able to improve her farm, as well as her harvest.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: Vilina

texts.en:
Vilina is a vegetable farmer from Bohol, Philippines. She is a married woman and has four children. Vilina has been in the farming business for more than 14 years, and this is the source of her income.

Vilina is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides. This will help her improve her farm, as well as her harvest.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is 42 years old and has five children. She is married, and three of her children are in school.

Anabelle is in the agricultural business, doing pig fattening in the Philippines.  She has been doing this for six years, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

Anabelle requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 39 years old and married, with six children, five of whom are in school. Gloria works very hard to provide for them.

Gloria runs a buy-and-sell firewood business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional stocks of firewood to sell.

Gloria has been in this business for six years. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her buy-and-sell firewood business.

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Lorenza Isabel

texts.es: Doña Lorenza de 58 años de edad habita con su esposo y su hijo de 15 de edad en casa propia. Doña lorenza es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora. Hace algunos años se decidió en poner un pequeño negocio en su hogar de residencia. El negocio consiste en una pequeña tienda que con gran esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mantener a lo largo de  varios años. Cuenta con mucha clientela ya que para ella lo más importante son los clientes, siempre los atiende con una sonrisa y mucha amabilidad, razón por la cual se ha ganado la confianza de muchos en la zona y a demás porque siempre tiene lo que los clientes buscan. Ella  sueña con dar a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida y sabe que la única fuente de ingresos es su pequeño negocio, por tanto no puede descuidarse de  el, por lo que cada día trabaja duramente para por mantenerlo activo. Es por esta razón que se motivo en solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para poder invertir en su tiendita y abastecerla con todo tipo de productos como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, café, golosinas, aceite, papel, detergente, y de más productos atractivos para los clientes. Confía que de esta manera logrará cumplir su sueño.
texts.en:
58-year-old Lorenza lives with her husband and 15-year-old son in her own home.  She is an entrepreneurial, determined woman.  Some years ago, she decided to set up a small business in her home.  The business is a small store which she has managed to keep running over the years through a lot of hard work and dedication.  She has a lot of customers because she considers them to be the most important thing in her business.  She always serves them with a smile and a lot of friendliness.  For this reason, she has gained the trust of a lot of people in her area and she always has what her customers are looking for.  Lorenza dreams of giving her son a better quality of life and she knows that the only source of income she has is her small business.  For this reason, she can't neglect it and works hard every day to keep it running.  

Lorenza is requesting a loan from Integral to invest in her small store.  She will stock it with all kinds of products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, coffee, candies, oil, paper, detergent and other products that her customers want.  She believes that, in this way, she will manage to make her dream come true.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, milk, coffee, candies, oil, paper, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Angela Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Angela, una señora trabajadora que muy de mañana se levanta a abrir su pequeño negocio de librería al que a la par ha estado invirtiendo poco a poco productos como ropa y cosméticos para garantizar pagar los gastos del hogar y ayudar a sus hijos a continuar la escuela, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien gana muy poco como docente, pero así buscan como salir adelante acomodándose de una u otra manera. Este onceavo crédito que solicita lo utilizara para invertir nuevamente en su negocio con productos que le hace falta para mantener siempre la clientela.
texts.en: Angela is a hard-working woman who wakes up early to open her small business, a stationery store, in which she has been investing, little by little. She now also sells products such as clothes and cosmetics to ensure that she has enough to pay the household expenses and can help her children stay in school. Her husband supports her, but he earns very little as a teacher. Nevertheless, they find ways to get by. This is the eleventh loan that Angela is requesting, and she will use it to invest in buying products that she needs for her business so that she retains her customers.

loans.use: to buy pencils, notebooks, reams of paper, shirts, and pants.

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
Apolonia is 63 years old, married, and has four children.  

Apolonia is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines.  She has been raising livestock for five years, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Apolonia has now requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her livestock.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 48 years old, married, and has four children, three of them in school. Evelyn works very hard to provide for them. She runs a business, buying and selling recyclable materials, in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more recyclable materials to sell. Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more recyclable materials to sell

loans.name: Everita

texts.en:
Everita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

Everita requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF. She intends to use the loan to purchase additional vegetables to sell. Everita would like to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma, 45, is a married woman who has six children. Four of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Gemma has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional vegetables to sell at her food stall. Gemma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell at her food stall

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 45 years old and has six children. She is married and three of her children are in school.

Susan is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Susan has been pig-fattening for 23 years now and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her pig-fattening business.

In the future, Susan would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
María, requiere de un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de seguir invirtiendo en el negocio; este le permitirá comprar maíz, leña y asimismo para arreglar la cocina de gas industrial.
El crédito anterior le ha permitido lograr los objetivos esperados, ya que ha tenido incremento en los ingresos; las circunstancias condiciones y familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en:
María needs a new loan so that she can continue investing in her business.  This loan will allow her to buy corn and firewood, and to have her industrial gas stove repaired.

María's previous loan enabled her to achieve her goals as she increased her income and improved her family's situation.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood, and to have her industrial gas stove repaired

loans.name: El Altiplano Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “EL ALTIPLANO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Maria Elena ella es soltera y tiene 41 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,leche y aceite, la socia tiene un puesto en el mercado que es una tienda de abarrotes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de celulares, negocio de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de ropa.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to EL ALTIPLANO Communal Bank. This bank is located in the Anta district, in Cusco province, Cusco department,
María Elena is one of the members. She is 41 years old, single, and has one child. She runs a stall selling basic supplies such as rice, sugar, milk, and oil. The stall is located in the market. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. and has been running the business for 7 years. The business is doing well and she dreams of making it bigger. She is requesting the loan to buy milk, sugar, oil, and rice. 
The other members of the group work in cell phone sales, run convenience stores, and sell clothes. 
María is grateful to those who form a part of this dream and pledges to make the payments within the established timeframe.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, oil, and rice.

loans.name: Nelson David

texts.es:
Nelson, se le presenta la necesidad de mas capital de trabajo por lo que solicita un nuevo préstamo; este le permitirá comprar los insumos necesarios tales como: abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas.
El crédito anterior le  ayudo a aumentar la productividad y sus utilidades las invierte en los gastos del hogar; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Nelson needs more working capital and, for this reason, he is requesting a new loan.  This loan will allow him to buy the inputs he needs such as fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides and pesticides.

Nelson's previous loan helped him to increase his productivity and he invested his profits into covering his household expenses.  His financial and family situations have both improved.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides and pesticides

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en:
Encarnacion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has had a general store business in the Philippines for 39 years.  She earns additional income from mobile prepaid load.

Encarnacion successfully repaid her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store and mobile prepaid load. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, such as canned goods, soap, sugar, milk, etc. for her general store business.

Encarnacion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, soap, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Nilda works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing.  Nilda is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional dried fish for her business.

Nilda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 45 years old and married with 5 children.

Maria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, snack foods, and other groceries.

Maria has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for six years, and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Maria aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, snack foods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is 51 years old and married with six children. Edna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell, such as chips, bread, coffee, sugar, milk, soap, canned goods, etc. Edna has borrowed and repaid eleven loans from NWTF prior this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from farming rice and rice retailing. Edna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell, such as chips, bread, coffee, sugar, milk, soap, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Chingky

texts.en: Chingky is married and works hard to support her family. She earns a living by selling clothing in the Philippines and is requesting a loan for PHP 12,000 from NWTF to buy more clothing to sell. She has been in this business for two years, and would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina is 58 years old, married and the mother of five children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines and is requesting a loan for PHP 29,500 to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She has been farming for the last nine years and supplements her income by raising pigs. She is working tirelessly to attain her dream: build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en: Aurelia is 50 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. Aurelia works very hard to provide for them. Aurelia runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. Aurelia has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, vinegar, canned goods, noodles, etc. In the future, Aurelia would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en: Ma. Teresa is 19 years old, married and earns a living by raising poultry in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 from NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens. She has been in this line of work for three years and supplements her income by farming vegetables. She is working tirelessly to attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens.

loans.name: Jose Noe

texts.es:
José, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de más capital de trabajo para invertir en el cultivo de maíz y frijol; este le permitirá comprar abono, insecticidas, plaguicidas, pesticidas, herbicidas para realizar la siembra.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a adquirir los insumos agrícolas de una sola vez y con las ganancias logro apoyar a su familia; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado, ya que sus hijos continúan estudiando.
texts.en:
José is requesting a loan as he needs to invest in farming supplies to grow corn and beans. He is going to buy manure, insecticides, pesticides, and herbicides to be able to sow his crops. 

With his previous loan, he bought farming supplies and used the profits he earned to support his family. His financial situation and family circumstances have improved, and his children have been able to continue studying.

loans.use: to buy manure, insecticides, pesticides, and  herbicides to be able to sow his crops.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is 43 years old and married with two children. Gina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items such as rice sugar, cooking oil, eggs and other groceries. Gina has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF prior this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from pig fattening. Gina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items, such as rice sugar, cooking oil, eggs and other groceries.

loans.name: Esperanza Flor

texts.es:
Esperanza se dedica a las ventas ambulantes en el centro de la ciudad de Rionegro, Colombia desde hace siete años trabaja en un pequeño puesto donde vende toda clase de dulces. Trabaja de 10:00 a.m. a 7:00 p.m. Asegura que lo más difícil es la temporada de invierno donde las ventas disminuyen notablemente.
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido con el propósito de contribuir con los gastos de su hogar y garantizarles a sus cuatro hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Sueña con tener su propio local y no tener que padecer las inclemencias del clima.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a street vendor in the city center of Rionegro, Colombia. She has had a small kiosk where she sells all kinds of candy for seven years. She works from 10am to 7pm and says that the winter season is the most difficult because sales go down significantly. 

She is now requesting a loan to buy candy. Her goal is to contribute to her household expenses and to guarantee a better quality of life for her four children. She dreams of having her own store so that she does not have to endure the harsh weather.

loans.use: to buy candy.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años y eso le ha dado la capacidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el arroz, comercializa sus cultivos en agencias de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene,  el cliente  esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos agrícolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas, semillas, etc. y así poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitación.
texts.en: The member has been working in agriculture for several years and this has given him the abilities and knowledge necessary to tend to his crops. His main crop is rice. He sells the products of the harvest to basic grains agencies close to where he lives. He uses the profits he makes to help out with the household and family expenses. He is requesting a loan to buy farming supplies such as manure, fertilizers, herbicides, and seeds, etc. to help him sow his crops and obtain more profits, so that he can continue helping out with the household expenses without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers, herbicides, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy gasoline, paint, bamboo, and wood for her fishing boat.

Divina has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from selling dried fish. Divina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, paint, bamboo, and wood for her fishing boat

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es:
Carlos de 47 años de edad, es un fami-empresario que con su trabajo sabe ganarse la vida. Dedicado al oficio de la panadería desde hace más de 15 años este hombre lucha por sacar adelante su familia y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Diariamente inicia su faena en conjunto con su hijo mayor desde las 2:30 am hasta las 3:00 pm, elaboran toda la producción del día y luego la distribuyen en las diferentes tiendas y supermercados de su localidad. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos y adecuaciones locativas. 
Su mayor anhelo es poder independizar su negocio de su casa, ya que el espacio es muy reducido.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 47-year old man and entrepreneur who has known how to make a living with his job. He has worked in breadmaking for over 15 years and fights to get ahead and provide his family with a better quality of life. He starts working with his older son at 2.30am every day and finishes at 3pm. They make all the production for the day and then distribute to the various stores and supermarkets in their city. 

He is now requesting a loan to buy food supplies and to make some improvements at his facilities. His biggest dream is to have an independent store outside of his home, given that the space today is very limited.

loans.use: to buy food supplies for breadmaking.

loans.name: Carlos Ernestor

texts.es: Don Carlos de 51 años de edad, el se dedica a vender huevos en las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace 3 años con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logar solventar los gastos de su hogar, tiene mucha clientela pues su producto es muy vendible y lo  da a un precio muy accesible el quiere acrecentar su negocio comprando huevos al por mayor por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo antes mencionado y así obtener mejores ganancias y poder tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Carlos is 51 years old and has been working for 3 years selling eggs in neighborhoods close to where he lives. He uses the profits to cover household expenses, and he has many customers because there is a high demand for the product, which he offers at a very affordable price. He wants to grow his business by buying eggs at wholesale, and for this reason, he is requesting a loan. He wants to increase his profits and therefore increase his financial stability.

loans.use: to buy eggs at wholesale.

loans.name: Lourdes Sara

texts.es: La Sra.  Lourdes tiene 34 años,  se dedica  a la   venta de cosméticos por catalogo, ella vende sus productos de manera ambulante, visitando domicilios y oficinas públicas y privadas de la ciudad de El Alto,  donde ofrece sus productos como también tiene una tienda donde tiene productos para vender,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Lourdes va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de cosmético y joyas por mayor y que se encuentran en promoción y de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra.  Lourdes va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de productos de belleza, la Sra.  Lourdes es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Lourdes is 34 years old and sells cosmetics by catalog. She is a mobile salesperson and goes to homes and public and private offices in the city of El Alto where she offers her products. She also has a store where she sells her products. This loan will be her first from the institution. Lourdes is going to use this loan to buy cosmetics and jewelry at wholesale and on special offer so that she can offer a greater variety of products to her customers and increase her profits. She is requesting the loan so that she can continue to improve her business. Lourdes is going to use the profits she makes to continue buying beauty products. Lourdes is a very hard-working woman and is happy to be receiving this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and jewelry at wholesale.

loans.name: Melda

texts.en:
Melda is 43 years old, married, and has four children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 15 years.  She earns additional income from farming rice. 

Melda is requesting a loan from NWTF for 25,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more livestock to sell.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 43 years old and married, with six children.

She earns a living by farming corn in the Philippines. Chona is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fertilizer, corn seed, insecticides, and other farm supplies.

Chona has been farming corn for two years and earns additional income from farming rice. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, corn seed, insecticides, and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente es un hombre trabajador y responsable, actualmente vive en casa propia con su familia, se dedica a la producción de miel de abeja desde hace varios años por lo que cuenta con una gran experiencia en la elaboración de la miel, es muy conocido en la zona donde reside las personas lo buscan con frecuencia para la compra de ello ya que los precios son accesible y la miel es de buena calidad, por lo cual hoy en día desea solicitar un crédito para la compra de azúcar cruda para la alimentación de las abejas y así poder seguir con el negocio ya que es la única forma con la que el se gana la vida.
