texts.en: This client is a hardworking, responsible man.  He’s currently living with his family in his own house.  He has worked producing honey for several years and has vast experience in honey making.  He’s very well-known in the zone where he lives and people seek him out frequently to buy it because his prices are affordable and the honey is good quality which is why he now wants to request a loan to buy raw sugar to feed the bees and continue in business since this is the only way he has to earn a living.

loans.use: to buy raw sugar to feed his bees.

loans.name: Transito

texts.es: Doña Transito de edad de 57 años vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo de 19 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años, su principal cultivo es el maíz pues tiene ya mucha experiencia en producirlo,  con las ventas que realiza de sus granos básicos logra cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  doña transito solicita un crédito que le permita comprar abonos, pesticidas, herbicidas y foliares  y poder seguir con sus cosechas para poder obtener mejores ganancias y tener una mejor vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Transito, 57, lives in her own house with her husband and 19-year-old son.  She’s worked in agriculture for several years and her main crop is corn; she has much experience producing it.  With sales of her basic grains she’s able to cover her household expenses.  

Transito is asking for a loan to buy manure, pesticide, herbicide and leaf fertilizers to continue with her crops in order to earn higher profits and have a better life with her family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Hayat Al-Zohoar Group

texts.en:
Hayat Al-Zohoar group consists of four poor women from Al-Hodeidah governorate, Yemen. They have asked for a loan of 90,000 Yemeni rial (YER).
Saedah, 44 years old, is an educated, married women and a mother of children. She lives with her family in Al-Hodeidah city. She has been working as a dressmaker for about five years. She started her business to help her husband provide a decent life for her children. 
These days, Saedah faces some problems with her sewing machine; it has become old and slow. She wants to buy a new sewing machine, so she applied for 30,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB). Saedah looks forward to being one of the well-known dressmakers in her community and starting to sew new models.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 70 years old, married, and has two children. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years. She earns additional income from farming rice.

Milagros is requesting her nineteenth loan from NWTF for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to buy items such as eggs, spices, noodles, and canned goods. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items such as eggs, spices, noodles, and canned goods.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en: As a married parent of three children, Vanessa works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables. Vanessa is requesting a PHP9,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell. Vanessa has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food supplies

loans.name: María Dolly

texts.es: María Dolly, es una mujer a la que le ha tocado rebuscarse la vida para educar a sus dos hijos. En búsqueda de  una fuente de ingresos decidió montar en su vivienda una tienda en la que labora diariamente, con esta actividad ha podido solventar las necesidades y mejorar su calidad de vida. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el cual comprará surtido, para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Su mayor sueño es aumentar sus ingresos para gozar de una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
María Dolly’s a woman who has had to dig deep in life in order to educate her two children.  Seeking a source of income led her to open a store at home where she works every day.  With this activity she’s been able to cover her needs and improve quality of life.  

She’s currently asking for a loan to buy stock merchandise to meet customer demand.  Her greatest dream is to increase income so she can enjoy economic stability.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es: La Sra. Benita tiene 53 años, es cliente antigua de la institución , se dedica a la venta de sombreros y también como segunda actividad a la venta de variedad de verduras en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la zona de Chasquipampa, en los anteriores créditos utilizo el dinero en la compra de sombreros por mayor, en esta ocasión   va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de verduras, tomate por mayor,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que quiere abastecerse de este producto, la Sra. Benita enfrenta retos en su negocio que el tener que levantarse temprano para comprar sus verduras y la competencia y  va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar cosas para su vivienda, se siente feliz ya agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Benita is 53 years old and is a long-term client of the institution. She sells hats and also has a second job selling vegetables from a stall that is located in the Chasquipampa area. She used her previous loans to buy hats at wholesale, and on this occasion, she is going to use the loan to buy vegetables and tomatoes at wholesale. Her reason for requesting the loan is that she wants to stock up on these products. Benita has to overcome many challenges to make her business work. She wakes up very early in the morning to buy her vegetables and there is a lot of competition from other sellers. She is going to use the profits to buy things for her house. She feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support that it has offered her.

loans.use: to buy vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Berta Delmira

texts.es: Berta, es una madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella es una mujer muy responsable y quien tiene como prioridad principal sacar adelante a su hijo. Ella posee una venta de tortillas, en la cual se encarga de elaborar cada mediodía y cada noche. Su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación. Berta desea mucho poder mejorar su negocio, ya que este brinda ganancias muy estables, lo cual le permite sostener a su familia, es por esto que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar maíz por mayor y cal, esto para elaborar mayor cantidad de tortillas, sobretodo los fines de semana que su demanda se incrementa debido a que muchas otras tortillerías están cerradas y así ella pueda obtener mayores ganancias las cuales le permitan mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Berta is a single mother who lives in her own house with her son.  She is a responsible woman and her main goal is to help her son progress.  She has a business selling tortillas, which she makes every day, morning and night.  Her business is located where she lives.  She has a great desire to improve her business, since it provides her with reliable income and allows her to support her family.

For this reason, she is asking for a loan to buy corn wholesale and also lime.  This will allow her to make more tortillas, which will be especially helpful for the weekends when many other tortilla shops are closed.  In this way, she will be able to obtain greater profits and improve her financial stability.

loans.use: buy wholesale corn and lime.

loans.name: Zonia Aida

texts.es:
Zonia, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo; este le permitirá comprar la materia prima para la elaboración de comida típica tales como: leña, maíz, aceite, verduras, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a obtener mejores ingresos; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en:
Zonia is in need of opting for a new loan because she needs more working capital. This will allow her to buy the raw materials to make traditional food she sells, such as firewood, corn, oil, vegetables and more.

The previous loan helped her obtain more income. The financial conditions and circumstances of her family have improved.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn, oil, vegetables and more.

loans.name: Lubian Andrès

texts.es:
Jubian de 25 años, es un hombre lleno de  sueños y con una meta clara; convertirse en microempresario. Asegura que la gastronomía es su mayor pasión, por lo cual, se encuentra solicitando un crédito para capacitarse en el oficio, con el propósito de mejorar la labor que realiza en su actual trabajo.
Asegura que uno de sus mayores sueños es tener la oportunidad de tener su propio negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus padres. Razón por la que colocará todo su empeño para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Jubian is 25 years old. He is a man who is full of dreams and with a clear goal: to become a micro-businessman. He says that cooking is his biggest passion. That is why he is asking for a loan to train in this field, with the purpose of improving the work he does at his present job. 

He says that one of his biggest dreams is to have the chance to have his own business and improve his parents' quality of life. That is the reason he is putting all of his hard work into getting ahead.

loans.use: to do culinary training

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 40 years old, married, and has two children. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 12 years.  She earns additional income from selling food.

Estelita is requesting her fifth loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase items such as biscuits, soap, diapers, and other miscellaneous items. She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items such as biscuits, soap, and diapers

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna is a hard-working entrepreneur who owns a general store in the Philippines. She is requesting a PHP21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell at her general store business. Lorna has been in this business for five years. She also earns more income from pig fattening. Lorna sustains her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Reina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Reina de 45 años, es una mujer motivada por el deseo de ver sus cuatro hijos menores con una mejor calidad de vida. Manifiesta que no tuvo la oportunidad de educarse en una escuela debido a la carencia económica de su familia por lo cual desea que sus hijos tengan esta oportunidad. Reina se ha dedicado a la confección por más de 10 años, oficio que aprendió gracias a su madre. En la actualidad labora como independiente desde su casa realizando costuras y confección a terceros. Desea mejorar su productividad e ingresos por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará para la compra de insumos con el propósito de sacar la producción solicitada. 
Desea ser reconocida en su sector con el fin de aumentar el volumen de su trabajo y convertirse en una fuente de ingresos para otras personas de su municipio
texts.en:
Reina, 45, is a woman motivated by her wish to see her four minor children have better quality of life.  Shed states that she never had the opportunity to go to school because of her family’s lack of economic resources so she wants her children to have this opportunity.

Reina has worked making clothes for more than ten years, an occupation she learned from her mother.  She currently works independently at home doing sewing and clothes making for third persons.  She wants to improve productivity and income which is why she’s asking for a loan to buy supplies needed to produce what’s required.  She wants to be well-known in her sector so that volume of work will increase and she can become a source of employment for others in her town.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Rachel Edith

texts.es:
Rachel, requiere de un nuevo préstamo porque  necesita de más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio de venta de alimentos; este le permitirá comprar carnes, pollos, maíz, leña, arroz, verduras, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a generar aumento en los ingresos; las condiciones económicas y familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Rachel is in need of another loan because she needs more working capital in order to continue investing in her business selling food.  This will allow her to buy meat, chicken, corn, firewood, rice, vegetables, and other things.

Her previous loan helped her to increase her income and her financial conditions and family life have improved.

loans.use: buy meat, corn, firewood, rice, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Denalyn

texts.en:
Denalyn is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks to sell, like canned goods, eggs, soap, shampoo, and chips for her general store business.

Denalyn has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from selling ginger.

Denalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell, like canned goods, eggs, soap, shampoo, and chips.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 29 years old and married, with three children.

Lucia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more items, like canned goods, snack foods, and other groceries.

Lucia has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from pig-fattening and selling bananas.

Lucia aspires to save money to expand her business and to repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more items, like canned goods, snack foods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Para comprar arroz, frijol, aceite, azúcar, entre otros productos.

loans.name: Mónica

texts.es:
Mónica de 41 años de edad, administra un estanquillo de su propiedad, el cual ha logrado sacar adelante con su esfuerzo y dedicación. Asegura que la panificación siempre ha sido una de sus grandes pasiones por lo cual asegura que es momento de retomar su sueño y convertirlo en su realidad. Motivo que la ha impulsado a ir en búsqueda de un crédito con el fin de capacitarse en este oficio y en un futuro cercano crear su propia panadería. 
Sueña con seguir creciendo dentro del ámbito comercial y ahora de alimentos, para garantizarles a sus dos hijos una mejor calidad de vida y una buena educación.
texts.en:
Monica is 41 years old and runs a newsagents from home, which she has made successful through hard work and dedication. She says that baking has always been one of her passions, and this is why she has decided it is the moment to make her dream reality. She decided to apply for a loan to pay for her training in this trade so that in the near future she can set up her own bakery.
Her dream is to continue making progress in trading and now in food preparation so that she can guarantee a better quality of life and a better education for her children.

loans.use: to pay for training in breadmaking.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila, tiene 47 años de edad es una mujer alegre, entusiasta  y emprendedora,está casada con Sinecio quien es conductor de maquinaria pesada,  vive con su pareja, y su hijo que tiene 19 años de edad.  Vive en su casa propia la cual compro con el apoyo de su pareja.El trabajo que realiza Zoila, es la crianza de pollos, ésta crianza lo realiza en su propio terreno, donde tiene instalado un espacio con 200 pollos, ésta actividad la viene realizando desde hace  05 años consecutivos, tiempo en el cual le valió para hacerse conocida  por los vecinos y compradores  mayoristas que le compran los pollos. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que es rentable, le da un buen ingreso económico que le permite pagar sus gastos, y le permite estar en todo momento con sus hijos. Lo que no le gusta es que los alimentos del pollo varían el en precio, lo cual hacen variar sus márgenes de ganancia, pero  esto no la desanima para seguir trabajando. Nos comenta que tiene planes de criar mayor cantidad de pollos por que así obtendrá mayor ingreso económico.Este es su octavo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante.
Con el préstamo solicitado de 3500 nuevos  soles comprará más pollos y comida balanceada para sus animales.
texts.en: Zoila is 47 years old and is a happy, enthusiastic and enterprising woman. She is married to Sinecio, who is a heavy machinery operator. She lives with him and her 19 year old son in their own home. Zoila works raising chickens on her own land, where she has an installation that can house up to 200 chickens. She has been doing this kind of work for 5 years, time in which she has made herself known to her neighbors and customers who buy her chickens. What she likes about her job is that it is profitable, provides her with a good income and helps her to pay for her expenses. It also allows her to be with her children at any given time. What she doesn't like about her work is that chicken feed varies in price, which can cut into her profits, but this doesn't daunt her and she continues to work. She tells us that she has plans to expand her business so that she can earn even more. This is her eighth loan with Kiva and she is very thankful for the financial support she has received and helped her to be successful. With this new loan she will purchase more chickens and a balanced feed for her chickens.

loans.use: purchase chickens and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a cooking course.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma is 40 years old and married with four children. With three children currently in school, Thelma works very hard to provide for them. Thelma runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items, such as shampoo, laundry soap, sugar, coffee, soft drinks, snack foods, etc. Thelma would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Neftaly  Omar

texts.es: Neftalí de 38 años de edad vive junto a su esposa, el es un hombre muy responsable quien siempre está en miras de mejorar su estabilidad económica. El trabaja en su propia panadería en la que elabora pan francés, el cual elabora el mismo a primeras horas de la madrugada para poder venderlo antes del desayuno, que es cuando las personas más lo consumen al igual que en la cena. Así mismo también comercializa pollos el cual vende por libra, lo que le brinda una gran ayuda económica. El solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para contar con la ayuda necesaria para invertir en la compra de harina, levadura, manteca, latas y todo lo necesario para poder producir más pan al igual que más pollos para el negocio. Este proyecto de mejoramiento para su panadería es muy importante para el puesto ya que así mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Neftalí is 38 years old and lives with his wife.  He is a very responsible man and always is on the lookout for ways to improve his financial stability.  He works in his own bakery, where he makes French bread.  He bakes it early in the morning in order to sell it before breakfast, which is when (along with dinnertime) people eat it the most.

At the same time, he sells chicken (by the pound), which is a great help to him, financially speaking.

He is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL so he can have all the help he needs to buy flour, yeast, lard, cans, and everything else that he needs to make more bread.  He will also buy more chickens for his business.  This improvement project for his bakery is very important to him, since it will allow him to improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: buy flour, yeast, lard, cans, etc.

loans.name: Yeimi Astrid

texts.es:
Yeimi de 36 años, es madre soltera de un hijo de siete años de edad, Asegura que él es su principal motivación y la razón por la que desea trabajar fuertemente a fin de garantizarle una mejor calidad de vida. Desde hace tres años labora como independiente vendiendo ropa y accesorios como actividad económica con la que genera el sustento y la educación de su hijo. Se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido con el fin de entregar a tiempo los encargos solicitados por parte de sus clientes. 
Desea aumentar sus ventas y poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Yeimi, 36, is a single mother of a 7-year-old son.  She insists that he’s her main motivation and the reason why she works so hard in order to guarantee a better quality of life for him.  

She’s been working independently for the last three years selling clothes and accessories; this economic activity provides support and schooling for her son.  She’s asking for a loan to buy stock so she can fill customer orders on time.  She wants to increase sales to be able to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothes and accessories.

loans.name: Sonia Martina

texts.es:
Doña Sonia tiene una edad de 36 años es casada y es madre de 9 hijos los cuales en su mayoría estudian y ayudan a sus padres con las diferentes actividades en el campo como ser: Limpieza, Abono, Fertilización, lavado, etc.  Del producto final. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completado cursado hasta el 6 grado gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres. En compañía de su familia se dedican al cultivo de maíz y frijoles el cual es comercializado en bodegas y con algunos clientes que compran la cosecha antes de su producción. 

Hoy en día ella solicita ayuda para la compra de abono, fertilizantes entre otros para fortalecer sus cultivos de maíz y frijol actividad que es el único medio de ingreso para ella y su familia.  

Su sueño es poder darles a sus hijos una buena educación, mejores herramientas de trabajo como ser el estudio que se puedan defender en la vida y tener una base para enfrentar todo problema económico de manera favorable.
texts.en:
Sonia, 36, is married and has nine children, who study and help their parents with different field chores: weeding, fertilizing, washing the product, and so forth. Thanks to her parents, Sonia completed the sixth grade. She and her family grow corn and beans to sell in the market and to customers who buy the harvested crops directly. 

Now she has applied for help to buy fertilizer and manure to improve her corn and bean crops. Farming is the only income she and her family have. She dreams of giving her children a good education and better tools, such as studying, with which to face life and have a base to deal with financial problems.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure for her corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Aleli

texts.en: Aleli works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Aleli requested a 17,500 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase ingredients for her business. She has been in this business for 24 years now. In the future, Aleli would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her business

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
This is Naomi from Liberia.  She is 39, and married with three children.  Her children are between the ages of 2 and 17.  Two are currently living at home and are in school.  

Naomi lives in Paynesville North, which is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia.  Paynesville North has the largest market in Montserrado County.  The area is home to 'round time marketers', traders who travel to the interior to purchase various goods to sell throughout the county.  As a result, there is a high concentration of wholesalers in the area who distribute to various markets around Montserrado County, including Monrovia.

Naomi started her business with money from her mother; she has owned her own table business for the past ten years, selling rubber dishes such as bowls, plates, spoons, etc.  She transports her merchandise by taxi, and on average, she works at her business six day of a week, spending ten hours each day.  She cites the high price of goods as her biggest challenge.  Her favorite part of the business is it keeps her busy.

She will use the loan to purchase more rubber dishes(bowls, plates, spoons, etc)for her business.  
    
In the future, she would like to own a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rubber dishes(bowls, plates, spoons, etc)for her business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Please meet Martha, a 32-year-old woman from Liberia.  She is married, and her husband works as a security guard.  They live in Nimba County, in Liberia.  Nimba is one of the most resource-rich areas in Liberia, producing minerals such as iron ore.  The county shares a border with both Cote D’Ivoire and Guinea.  As a result, many people on business pass through the area, bringing lots of trade.  It is also the second most populous area in Liberia.

Martha has had her own shop for two years now.  She sells groceries, for example, rice, flour, candy, biscuits and milk.  She works at her business nine hours per day.  She transports her goods to her business by bus. The biggest challenge she faces in her business is having too few goods in her shop.  She will use the loan to buy more inventory.

She went to school and finished grade 12. She has a 7-year-old child.  She describes herself as a hardworking woman.  She started her business with money from her mother. In the future, she wants to own a house.  Martha is proud of her business, because she earns money every day, for her expenses.  She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for her store.

loans.name: Larwou

texts.en:
Larwou is 29 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most-populated market in Montserrado County. She is single, and she completed grade 12.  She described herself as a hardworking woman. For the past four years she has been operating her own table in the local market selling rice, pepper, onion, vita, salt etc. She sells six days a week from 7AM to 5PM. She likes her business, because she has more customers. She started this business with capital that was given to her by her mother. She uses a shared taxi every time, to get her goods to her business table.

Larwou is requesting a loan to purchase more goods(rice, pepper, onion, vita, salt etc) to sell at her business table in the market. She plans is to build a house for her children. She would like to say, "Thanks," to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more goods(rice, pepper, onion, vita, salt etc) to sell at her business table in the market.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 22-year-old Kadiatu, from Liberia. She lives in St. Paul, a suburb located outside Monrovia, past the Freeport.  It has one of the oldest markets in the country and is known for fresh fish, because it is located by the ocean.  However, it is also one of the poorer areas, and housing quality is often very bad. 

Kadiatu is single and has a three years old child. The child lives at home and goes to school.
 
Kadiatu has a sales table, where she sells foods like bread, sugar, oil and rice.  She has been in business for five years and works nine hours per day. With this loan, she will buy inventory.  One of the greatest challenges that she faces is low income.  She transports her goods by taxi.  She started her business with money from her father.  Kadiatu is proud of her business, because she makes more profit. Her plan is to build a house.  She would like to thank the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy inventory to sell at her table, like bread, sugar, oil and rice.

loans.name: Jhony Alexander

texts.es: Jhony de 20 años de edad, es un joven emprendedor, con su esfuerzo y pasión por el campo ha logrado sacar su proyecto de vida adelante. Desarrolla dos actividades simultáneas, en la primera labora como ayudante de construcción y en la segunda se dedica a cuidar de su ganado. Aprendió de estas actividades gracias a sus abuelos quienes han residido la mayor parte de su vida en la zona rural. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de ganado de levante, con el fin de dedicarse por completo a esta actividad. Sueña con aumentar su cabeza de ganado y retribuirle  a su familia años de sacrificios y cuidados hacia él.
texts.en:
Jhony is 20 years old and is a hardworking young man who has been able to progress his life through his efforts and passion for the countryside.  He has two jobs, the first of which is working as a construction assistant.  His other job involves taking care of his cattle.  He learned both of these trades from his grandparents, who have lived most of their lives in rural areas.

Currently, he is asking for a loan to buy beef cattle so he can focus completely on this job.  He dreams of increasing his head of cattle and paying his family back for the years of sacrifice and care that they have given him.

loans.use: buy cattle.

loans.name: Teffany Rose

texts.en:
Teffany Rose is a hard-working entrepreneur who has an e-loading (mobile prepaid load) business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy mobile prepaid load to sell to her customers.

Teffany Rose has been in this business for two years. She earns additional income by selling herbal medicines.

Teffany Rose has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy mobile prepaid load to sell.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is 56 years old and married, with five children.

She earns a living by pig-fattening in the Philippines. Lita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional feed for her pig.

Lita has been pig-fattening for six years and earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pig.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 29 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. Chona runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 16,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Chona has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from E-loading (mobile prepaid load).

Chona aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie is 39 years old, married and lives in Nimba County in Liberia. Nimba is one of the most resource-rich areas in Liberia, producing minerals such as iron ore. The county shares a border with both Cote D’Ivoire and Guinea. As a result, many people on business pass through the area, bringing lots of trade.  It is also the second most populous area in Liberia. 

Mamie has had a shop business for the past two years and sells palm oil. She works at her business 9 hours everyday. She transports her goods to her business by bus. The biggest challenge she faces in her business is fewer goods in her shop.  She did not attend school. She has four children between 22 and 4 years old.  

With the proceeds from the loan, she wants to buy inventory. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. She started her business with money from her mother. 

In the future, she wants to own a house. She is proud of her business because she gets money everyday for her expenses.  

She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Mayamu

texts.en:
Mayamu is 27 years old, single and lives in Nimba County in Liberia. Nimba is one of the most resource-rich areas in Liberia, producing minerals such as iron ore. The county shares a border with both Cote D’Ivoire and Guinea. As a result, many people on business pass through the area, bringing lots of trade. It is also the second most populous area in Liberia. 

Mayamu has had a shop business for the past two years and sells rice, oil, Vita (juice drink), salt, and bitter ball (an eggplant-like vegetable). She works at her business spending 10 hours every day. She transports her goods to her business by taxi.The biggest challenge she faces in her business is fewer goods in her shop.  

With the proceeds from the loan, she wants to buy inventory. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. She started her business with money from her mother. 

In the future, she wants to own a house. She is proud of her business because she gets money everyday for her expenses.  

She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Fortune

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 31-year-old Fortune from Bulawayo. He is single, with one child; he also cares for one dependent. 

Fortune runs a retail business selling consumer groceries, which includes drinks, milk, bread, sugar, rice and other items. The business has been in operation for four years. He says the main challenges he faces are lack of working capital to restock. 

Fortune has requested a loan of $750  to restock in bulk, thus avoiding constant trips to wholesalers, since he operates far from the town where they are located. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to cover his expenses, both at home and in the business. 

In the future, Fortune plans to save enough from the loan profits to enable him to complete the building of his own shop at the business centre.

loans.use: to order stock to sell in his grocery shop, including drinks, biscuits, sugar, maize meal, rice, bath soap, washing soap, juices and other various consumer goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy farming supplies (manure and insecticide).

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Doña Martina con una edad de 43 años no deja de luchar y de seguir adelante con sus sueños. Ella es madre de 6 hijos los cuales estudian en la escuela y al salir de sus actividades escolares ayudan con las actividades en el campo siendo solo y únicamente su familia la que se involucra en el campo. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completo y una experiencia en el cultivo de maíz y frijol como también café de más de 15 años siendo esta pasada de generación en generación. Sus clientes son los diferentes compradores que llegan a la zona y las diferentes bodegas que están en los alrededores y en la misma localidad donde ella habita.

Actualmente ella necesita una ayuda para la compra de insumos como ser: abono, fertilizantes y una bomba de fumigación para sus cultivos de maíz, frijol y café. 

Sus planes son los de incrementar el área de cultivo y mejorarlo implementando un sistema de riego que mejore el mantenimiento de la producción y de la tierra. Sus sueños son los de poder seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios para que tengan una buena educación y un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Martina, 43, does not stop fighting to continue forward with her dreams.  She’s the mother of six children who are attending school and when they get home from school help with field chores since all the farm work is done by the family.  

She completed primary school and has more than 15 years’ experience growing corn, beans and coffee; this has been passed down from generation to generation.  Her customers are various buyers that come through the zone and various warehouses that are in surrounding areas and in the area where she lives.  She needs a loan to help with the purchase of supplies like manure, fertilizer and a fumigation pump for her corn, bean and coffee crops.

Her plan is to increase the size of the area under cultivation and to improve it with an irrigation system that will improve production and maintenance of the soil.  Her dream is to be able to continue supporting her children’s schooling so they will have a good education and better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Reina Admit

texts.es:
Reina, requiere de más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo más en su negocio; este le permitirá comprar gallinas, leña, cocina industrial, hojas para brindarles un mejor servicio a los clientes.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a generar mejores utilidades, es por ello que las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en:
Reina needs more working capital to continue investing in her business. This will make it possible for her to buy chickens, firewood, an industrial stove and leaves to provide better customer service. 

Her previous loan helped her generate higher profits which led to her economic conditions and her family circumstances being optimized.

loans.use: to buy chickens, firewood, an industrial stove and leaves.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo; este le permitirá comprar abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, pesticidas.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar sus ingresos y con las ganancias ha logrado cubrir los gastos del hogar; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado gracias a la inversión del crédito otorgado por Kiva.
texts.en:
Luis is requesting a loan because he needs capital to invest in manure, herbicides, insecticides, and pesticides. 
His previous credit helped him to increase his income and with the profits he made he has been able to cover his household expenses. His financial situation and family circumstances have improved thanks to the investments he made with the Kiva loan

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides, insecticides, and pesticides.

loans.name: Orfilia

texts.es:
Doña Orfilia es una mujer de 46 años de edad, casada y de su matrimonio tiene 3 hijos los cuales viven en casa y solo uno de ellos estudia. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria no completado cursado hasta el 3 año y no pudo continuar por falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres. Ella se dedica al cultivo y siembra de maíz, frijoles y cafe hace más de 15 años en compañía de su esposo ya que ella aprendió esta actividad por parte de sus padres ya que viene de tradición la agricultura en su familia. Sus clientes son las diferentes personas que llegan a mercado en donde ella tiene un puesto de venta de su propio producto.

Actualmente ella necesita ayuda para la compra de insumos para poder mejorar su sus cosechas ya que esto fortalecerá la tierra, la planta, la raíz y el grano al final del ciclo. 

Sus planes a futuro son los de poder incrementar su área de cultivo comprando más tierra para ser un surtidor directo de las bodegas y otros intermediarios que distribuyen el producto. Sus sueños como madre es dejarles a sus hijos un patrimonio para que ellos tengan como enfrentar la pobreza de manera favorable.
texts.en:
Orfilia, 46, is married and has three children from the marriage who live at home; only one of her children is in school. She completed third grade; she was not able to continue because her parents could not pay for more schooling. 

She and her husband have been growing corn, beans, and coffee for over 15 years. She learned her trade from her parents, as farming was a family tradition. Her customers are people who come to the market where she has a stand to sell her products. 

She needs help to buy supplies to improve her harvest by fortifying the land, the plants, the roots, and the seeds at the end of the growing cycle. Her plans are to increase her farm land by buying more so that she can become a direct supplier to stores and other dealers who distribute the products. Her dream as a mother is to leave her children an inheritance that will help them overcome poverty.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her corn, bean, and coffee plants.

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Aurea works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling nipa in the Philippines. Nipa is a woven palm mat, used for house repair and construction. She earns additional income by farming rice.

Aurea is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan capital to buy more nipa to sell at her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more nipa to resell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elsa is 62 years old; one of her children is still in school.

Elsa has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 29,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more stock of items such as shampoo, bath soap, sugar, biscuits, candies, and other groceries to sell in her store.

Elsa has been in this business for 30 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store, like shampoo, bath soap, sugar, biscuits, candies, and other groceries.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is 59 years old and married with seven children. She is in the agriculture business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Eliza has been farming vegetables for 25 years now, and has borrowed from NWTF 13 times in the past to sustain her business.

Eliza requested a loan of 19,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy fertilizers and a variety of seedlings for her vegetable garden.

In the future, Eliza would like to save enough money to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and a variety of seedlings for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay for his tuition

loans.name: Korto

texts.en:
Korto lives and works in St. Paul.  St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for their fish due to its location by the sea.  St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Free-port.  It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 

Korto is 30 years old,she is married, and has a six years old child who is in school and live at home.

She runs a shop business selling charcoal.  She describes herself as a serious businesswoman. She started her business 15 years ago, using money given to her husband.  Typically, she works 7 am to 6 pm from Monday to Saturday at her business and transports her goods to her business by bus.  She cites her greatest challenge as insufficient capital.  She is proud of her business because it supports her home.

Using the proceeds of this loan, she intends to purchase more charcoal for her business.  In the future, she plans to build her house and educate her children.  She sincerely thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Maria Laura

texts.es: Doña María de 42 años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 12 años de edad en casa propia; ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda mas surtida, las personas la prefieren y la mantienen delante de la competencia porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes, como toda buena comerciante  quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, bebidas, etc. María tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María, 42, lives with her life companion and 12-year-old son in her own house.  She has a store where she sells basic staples like beans, milk, eggs and bread, among others.  She’s been in business for many years and has gained sales experience that allows her to earn the best profits.  The store is located in her place of residence in a very busy location.  She’s attained a large clientele because her store is better-stocked.  People prefer her over the competition because she always has what they need: quality products at affordable prices with unequaled customer service, always at her customers’ service.

Like all good merchants she wants to increase business and make a new investment but needs capital which is why she’s asking Integral for a loan to buy basic grains, snacks, eggs, bread, beverages, etc.  María has good payment references and is sure that she’ll repay the loan while trusting that she’ll provide better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Ma. Nelly

texts.en:
Ma. Nelly, a married mother of five children, works hard to support her family. She has a passenger transportation business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income by fattening pigs.

Ma. Nelly is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan capital to buy spare parts and tools for maintaining her trisikad. Ma. Nelly has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tools for maintaining her trisikad

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a Kubo Financiero client. This is her story.

"My name is Irene, and I am 42 years old.  I am married and have 3 sons, but only one is dependent on me.  I have been working in retail for the last three years, and decided to open a flower shop because my son was working in the same field.  The slogan for my shop is 'good quality and good service.'  I make bouquets for weddings and Quinceaniera [15-year-old coming of age] birthday parties.  I also make centerpieces for parties and pedestals, and all types of flower arrangements.  I will use this loan to buy a computer, because I want to have better control of my business.  I will also buy some counters and accessories to improve the image of my store.

My biggest accomplishment is providing a good life for my family, buying a car and buying furniture for my house."

loans.use: To buy a computer and refurbish her flower shop

loans.name: Nany

texts.en:
Nany lives and works in St. Paul.  St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for their fish due to its location by the sea.  St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Free-port.  It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 

Nany is 30 years old, she is single and has a 2 years old child. Her child live at home and in school. She completed 12 grades.

She runs a shop business selling used slippers.  She describes herself as a serious businesswoman. She started her business 15 years ago, using money given to her by her husband.  Typically, she works 7 am to 6 pm from Monday to Saturday at her business and transports her goods to her business by taxi.  She cites her greatest challenge as not enough capital.  She is proud of her business because it supports her home.

Using the proceeds of this loan, she intends to purchase more used slippers for her business.  In the future, she plans to build her house and educate her children.  She sincerely thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more used slippers for her business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca lives and works in St. Paul.  St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for their fish due to its location by the sea.  St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Free-port.  It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 

Rebecca is 39 years old, married, and has a 15 year old child who lives at home and is in school. She completed 6th grade.

She runs a shop business selling flour, fish, rice, etc.  She describes herself as a serious businesswoman. She started her business 15 years ago, using money given to her by her husband.  Typically, she works 7 am to 6 pm from Monday to Saturday at her business and transports her goods to her business by bus.  She cites her greatest challenge as not enough capital.  She is proud of her business because it supports her home.

Using the proceeds of this loan, she intends to purchase more flour, fish, rice etc for her business.  In the future, she plans to build her house and educate her children.  She sincerely thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, fish, rice, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Dora Isabel

texts.es: Doña dora de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad como: pan, leche, huevos, alimentos enlatados, agua embotellada, verduras y otros productos más. Ella es una persona muy responsable y amable la cual cuenta con varios clientes a pesar que su tienda no tiene mucha variedad de productos. Doña dora solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de productos, ya que el mayor deseo de ella es el de poder surtir su negocio y así percibir mayores ganancias. Ella es una madre de familia muy responsable quien desea mucho poder brindarle todo lo mejor.
texts.en:
Dora, 45, lives in her own house with her live companion and their two children. She has a store where she sells basic staples like bread, milk, eggs, canned food, bottled water, vegetables and other products.  She’s a very responsible, kind person who has many customers even though her store does not have a very big variety of products.  

Dora’s asking for the loan so she can have the money needed to buy a larger amount of products because she wants to better stock the store and earn higher profits. She’s a very responsible mother who very much wants to provide the best for her family.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is married with 5 children. Melanie is 51 years old and lives in Tabuc Norte, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. Melanie sells different varieties of fish to earn a living and has had this business for 30 years. 

She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan to pay for additional fish to sell
.
Melanie has been a member of PMPC for almost a year. In the future, Melanie hopes to expand her business and own a stall in the public market in the nearby town.

loans.use: to pay for additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Dynalyn

texts.en:
Dynalyn, a married parent of seven children, works hard to support her family. She has a business, buying and selling fish, in the Philippines. She earns additional income by keeping a general store.

Dynalyn is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan capital to buy additional stock of fish to resell at her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of fish to resell at her business

loans.name: Florena

texts.en:
Florena is 55 years old, married, and has four children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a variety store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. At the store, she sells a variety of items, including soap, soft drinks, rice and other groceries. 

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan capital to purchase more goods to sell at her store. Florena would like to save enough money to support the future financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell at her store, including soap, soft drinks, rice and other groceries

loans.name: Obed

texts.en:
Obed is a Kubo financiero client, this is his story:

"My name is Obed, I am 32 years old, I´m married and have three kids.  I work selling cleaning products and have been working since I was 16 years old, when my father started me in the business. The slogan for my business is 'for the benefit of Mexican families.'

I will use the loan to fix my car, which I use to sell my products.

I work selling different cleaning products and on the weekends I rent chairs, tables and tents. I am also a partner in a water purification business. My biggest accomplishment is being able to provide a good life for my family. I am a responsible person, like to honor my commitments and see my business grow."

loans.use: To fix my car that I use to sell cleaning products.

loans.name: Anith

texts.es:
Anith, de 41 años de edad, es una mujer  alegre, soñadora y emprendedora. Es divorciada y vive en su casa propia junto con su hijo de 16 años a quien quiere dar una buena educación y mejor calidad de vida.
Anith se dedica al diseño, confección  y venta de ropas para damas, caballeros y niños. Realiza esta actividad en un local en el interior de su vivienda propia. Lleva 12 años en esta actividad. Comenta que se  inicio en esta actividad por la necesidad de generar ingresos económicos para solventar los gastos de los estudios de su hijo. Realiza esta actividad económica junto a unas amigas a quienes contrata cada vez que tiene pedidos en grandes cantidades. Considera rentable esta actividad porque las empresas solicitan sus servicios para que haga los uniformes de sus trabajadores, también tiene contratos con los distintos colegios de la ciudad.Este será su sexto préstamo con Kiva, tiene ganas de seguir siendo puntual en su cuotas, porque le esta yendo muy bien.Con el monto solicitado de S/.600  soles comprará materiales como telas, blondas, elásticos, hilos para seguir confeccionando  y  produciendo.
texts.en:
Forty-one year old Anith is a cheerful enterprising woman who dreams big. She is divorced and lives in her own house with her 16 year-old son. She wants to provide him with a good education and a better quality of life. 

Anith earns a living designing, making and selling clothes for women, men and children. She carries out this activity in a workshop in her own house. She has been in the business for 12 years. She also notes that she began this business because she needed to earn an income to cover the cost of her son's education. She carries out this economic activity together with some friends whom she contracts whenever she has a large number of orders. She considers this activity to be profitable because companies contract her to make uniforms for their employees. She also has contracts with various schools in the city.

This will be her sixth loan with Kiva. She wants to continue making her payments on time because things are going very well for her.

With the requested 600 Peruvian Soles she will buy materials like fabric, lace, elastics and thread to continue making her products.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, and elastic bands among other items.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alicia Margarita

texts.es: Alicia vive con su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos, es comerciante de verduras. Inicio su negocio en el año 2008 eso le ha dado la experiencia necesaria para poder tener su negocio, vende en el mercado que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia tiene mucha clientela pues vende a buen precio las verduras, alicia solicita un préstamo para poder comprar zanahorias, elotes, tomates, repollos, ejotes, guineos, lechugas, etc. y todo lo que necesita para acrecentar su negocio y asi tener a sus clientes satisfechos cuando la busquen para comprarle sus productos y ella podra tener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a darle a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Alicia lives with her life companion and three children; she’s a vegetable merchant. She started her business in 2008 so has earned sufficient experience to stay in business. She sells in a market near her residence and has a large clientele because she sells her vegetables at a good price.  

Alicia’s asking for a loan to buy carrots, corn on the cob, tomatoes, cabbage, green beans, bananas, lettuce, etc. and everything needed to increase business and keep her customers satisfied when they come by to buy her products so she will earn the best profits that will help her give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en: Luciana is 59 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by running a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Luciana is requesting a PHP17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies for her pigs. Luciana has been in the pig-fattening business for 20 years and also earns additional income from a general store. Luciana successfully paid back her previous loan. She is working tirelessly to attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Jackielyn

texts.en:
Jackielyn is 25 years old, married, and has one child. She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. 

Jackielyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She intends to use the loan capital to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been farming vegetables for four years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain this activity. She would like to save money, to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lyneth

texts.en:
Lyneth is a married woman, and she works hard to support her family. She has a business selling frozen foods, in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years.

Lyneth requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF. She intends to use the loan to purchase more stock of frozen foods to resell. Lyneth would like to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of frozen foods to resell

loans.name: Nasrullo

texts.ru: Дом, где живет Насрулло, не отвечает стандартам жилья и он срочно должен отремонтировать свой дом. Ему 41 года, он женат и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Его жена занимается земледелием. Его мать живет вместе с ним. Насрулло с 1994 года работает в заводе и в свободное время помогает жене по земледелию. Он должен срочно отремонтировать свой дом, так как дети еще маленькие и мать старая. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США для покупки строительных материалов для ремонта дома. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: The house, where Nasrullo lives, does not comply with the living standards, and he needs to urgently repair the house.  He is 41 years old, married and raising four children.  His wife is involved in farming.  His mother lives with them.  Nasrullo has been working at a plant since 1994 and helps his wife with farming in his free time.  He has to urgently repair his house because his children are still small, and his mother is old.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 3,000 US dollars to purchase construction materials to repair his house.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to repair his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase manure, chemical fertilizers, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Ana Gladys

texts.es:
Ana, es una persona muy reconocida que por su sacrificio y convicción  ha logrado salir adelante con su negocio, vive solamente con su esposo y cuenta que tiene dos hijos, los cuales son independientes, no posee familiares en el extranjero. Ella se dedica a la confección de ropa para ambos sexos y servicio de baños, el oficio lo realiza desde hace 4 años de las 7:00am a 6:00pm.
Ana, requiere de un préstamo, el cual lo utilizara para comprar hilo, agujas, tela y para hacerle mejoraras a la máquina de costurar, asimismo optimizar el servicio que brinda; esta inversión le ayudara a obtener más clientes y realizarlo con más eficiencia, asimismo en el servicio de los baños le permitirá ofrecerle mayor comodidad e higiene.
Su sueño es seguir trabajando para incrementar sus ganancias y así construir su propia casa para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is very well-known for her sacrifice and dedication; she’s managed to get ahead with her business. She lives only with her husband. She relates that she has two children who are independent and she has no family members abroad.  She works making clothes for both genders and providing rest-room facilities.  She’s been in business four years and works from 7am until 6pm.

Ana needs a loan to buy thread, needles and fabric and to do some improvements to the sewing machine as well as to optimize the service she provides.  This investment will help her get more customers and to do so more efficiently.  Also, she will be able to increase comfort and hygiene in the rest-room services.  Her dream is to continue working to increase profits and build her own house to have better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies and to repair the sewing machine.

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su familia, su esposo y su hijo de 18 años de edad, el cual ya no depende económicamente de ella. Ana, se dedica a la confección de ropa para dama, el negocio nace a raíz de obtener ingresos para apoyar a su familia con los gastos, este oficio lo inicia con una maquina acústica, lo heredo de su madre quien le enseño hasta la edad de 15 años, ella tiene 10 años de experiencia.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar hilo, tela, agujas y asímismo para la reparación de la maquina; esta inversión le ayudar a incrementar la materia prima y con ello obtener mejor clientela, asimismo mayores ingresos.
Su sueño es que crezca su negocio y obtener mejores resultados para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her family: her husband and her 18-year-old son who no longer depends economically on her.  Ana works making women’s clothes.  The business arose from the need she had to help with family expenses.  She started the business with an acoustic machine that she inherited from her mother who taught her until the age of 15.  She now has 10 years’ experience.

She needs the loan to buy thread, fabric, needles and also to repair the machine.  This investment will help her increase her war materials and with this attain better clientele as well as increased income.  Her dream is that her business grows and yields better results to have better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies and to repair her sewing machine.

loans.name: Orifa

texts.ru: Земля является основным источником бизнеса и основной кормилицей в Таджикистане. Многие люди в примере Орифы занимаются земледелием и получают доход для проживания. Орифа более 4 лет занимается скотоводством. Ей 58 лет. Она замужем и имеет 1 сына. Ее сын женат и имеет 4 детей. Ее муж занимается предоставлением услуги тракториста. Для Орифы земледелие, то есть выращивание риса и капусты не только является источником дохода, но и любимым занятием. Она с удовольствием работает на поле с раннего утра до позднего вечера. Она ценит каждую частичку своей земли. Она планирует развевать бизнес, но  не имеет денег для покупки семена и минерального удобрения. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  12000  сомони для покупки семена и минерального удобрения. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Land is the primary business source and main food provider in Tajikistan.  Many people, like Orifa, are involved in farming and earn an income for living.  Orifa has been involved in farming for over four years.  She is 58 years old, married and has one son.  Her son is married and has four children.  Her husband is involved in providing a tractor-driving service.  Farming for Orifa, i.e. growing rice and cabbage, is not only a source of income, but a favorite activity.  She works on the field with satisfaction from morning to late evening.  She values every piece of her land.  She plans to develop the business, but does not have money to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers.  Orifa is requesting a loan in the amount of 12000 somoni to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: Josefa, de 36 años, es una mujer esforzada y alegre. Vive en su casa propia junto a  su esposo Yavaly, quien se dedica hacer taxi, también es su socio en su negocio. Tienen 02 hijos de 12 y 3 años de edad respectivamente.Josefa se deica a la confección de ropas para caballeros, damas y niños. Su actividad la realiza en la casa de unas de sus amigas, quien es su socia. Se inició en esta actividad ayudando en una empresa de textiles ahí aprendió lo necesario  y  decidió comprar su  maquina de coser para trabajar en su casa. Cada día sus clientes se incrementan pero antes de iniciar está actividad económica tenía temor de poner su negocio propio. Pero una amiga la ánimo y la apoyo a realizar sus primeras confecciones. Hasta ahora todo le esta yendo bien, cada día ve como su producción se incrementa y tiene ganancias económicas positivas.Este será su tercer préstamo con Kiva, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su negocio, por otro lado se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado de S/.800 soles, comprará materiales para su negocio tales como telas, hilos , elásticos , entre otros.
texts.en:
Josefa, 36, is a cheerful, hardworking woman living in her own house with her husband, Yavaly, who is a taxi driver and also her business partner.  They have two children who are 12 and 3 years of age respectively.  

Josefa works making clothes for men, women and children.  She does her work in one of her girlfriend’s house who is her partner. She started in this activity helping in a textile firm and learned what was necessary. She decided to buy a sewing machine to work from home.  Every day her customers increase but before starting this business she was afraid of starting her own business.   But a girlfriend encouraged her and helped her do her first articles of clothing.  To date, everything is going very well.  She sees how her production increases every day and she earns positive economic profits.

This will be her third Kiva loan and she’s very happy to know that she’ll have financial support because she’ll feel surer of making progress with her business.  She commits to pay her installments punctually.  She will use the requested 800 soles to buy business supplies like fabric, thread and elastic, among others.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Fien

texts.en:
She is married and has six children. The family lives in a four-bedroom apartment in Bamenda, Northwest Region of Cameroon. She has faced many challenges in life, such as sickness in her family, inadequate financing to properly manage her business, deaths of family loved ones, early marriage and dropping out of school by her children because she could not afford their schooling.

She has taken and repaid a loan successfully one time before. She says that with the new loan she will buy seeds, including sweet yam and bean seeds, plus manure for fertilizer. She holds a positive view of her business succeeding, because she has been farming for a long time. She has regular customers who buy her farm produce from her. She also supplies quality goods that cannot easily be destroyed. With this business activity, the community will have a regular supply of food, at reduced prices. She will also encourage many women to join farming.

GHAPE loans are preferable to her, because of the low interest rate, the convenient repayment interval, the trainings offered to GHAPE members before a loan is given, and the follow-up of the loan, which makes members work hard.

loans.use: to buy seeds, including sweet yam and bean seeds, and manure for fertilizer

loans.name: Ma. Rowena

texts.en:
Ma. Rowena is a married woman who has four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 47 years old. Ma. Rowena has a business, buying and selling ladies' accessories, in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 22 years.

Ma. Rowena requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan capital to purchase more accessories to sell. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more ladies' accessories to sell

loans.name: Muhammadjon

texts.ru: Мухаммадчон скотовод и житель горного района Вахш. Ему 34 года. Он женат и у него двухлетняя дочь и четырехлетний сын. Он живет в доме отца. Махаммадчон зарабатывает на жизнь путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Он обычно закупает бычков, выгуливает их на местном пастбище и после двух месяца откорма продает на скотном рынке района. Мухаммадчон занимается купле-продажей скота более 4-х лет и этот бизнес является единственным источником дохода его семьи. Он запрашивает кредит для своей животноводческой деятельности с целью увеличения поголовья продаваемого скота.
texts.en: Muhammadjon is a cattle breeder who lives in the mountainous region of Vakhsh. He is 34 years old, married, and has a two-year-old daughter and a four-year-old son. He lives with his father and earns a living breeding cattle. He usually buys calves, turns them out to pasture, and, after fattening them up for two months, sells them at the local cattle market. Muhammadjon has been buying and reselling cattle for more than four years, which is his family's only source of income. He is asking for a loan for his livestock business in order to sell more cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle to raise and resell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa con sus padres es madre soltera tiene una hija de 1 año de edad, ella se dedica a vender ropa y zapatos cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene ayuda en los gastos de su casa, la clienta solicita un credito para poder comprar mas mercadería por mayor y poder surtir su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su hija lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
The client lives with her parents.  She is a single mother, and she has a one year old daughter.  She sells clothes and shoes close to where she lives.  With the earnings that she gets she helps with the household expenses.

The client is requesting a loan to be able to buy more merchandise wholesale.  This way she will be able to stock her business in order to get better earnings to give her daughter what she needs without any limitation.

loans.use: to buy clothes wholesale.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 48 years old, married, and has one child. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Gina has been farming rice for six years, and she earns additional income by buying and selling nipa, which are woven palm mats used for house repair and construction.

Gina is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan capital to buy fertilizers and other rice farming supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other rice farming supplies

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Maria works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from general store. Maria has requested to borrow PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Gorgonia

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, who are currently going to school, Gorgonia works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending and direct selling Avon products. Gorgonia is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

Gorgonia has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her restuarant business.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 48 years old, married, and has two children. With one child currently in school, Amalia works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she sells a variety of items such as soap, shampoo, soft drinks, rice, bread and other groceries. 

Amalia has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to buy more inventory for her store. She would like to save enough money, to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her general store, such as soap, shampoo, soft drinks, rice, bread and other groceries

loans.name: José Ramón

texts.es:
El señor José Ramón vive en  Managua, labora para el estado como conserje desde hace catorce años, su estado civil es casado, tiene  tres personas  bajo su cargo, con buenos valores morales, es una persona luchadora para el bienestar de su familia.
 
Don José Ramón  se presento a Ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento para la construcción de un anexo de un cuarto, este crédito será invertido en compra de cemento, bloque, arena, hierro y pago de mano de obra. 

Espera que le sigan dando la mano amigable en estos pequeños créditos que tanto ayuda en el desarrollo de la familia con muchos deseos de vivir en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
José Ramón lives in Managua and has worked for the State as a janitor for 14 years. He is married and is responsible for 3 people. He has good moral values and is a person who strives for the wellbeing of his family.

José Ramón approached Ceprodel to ask for finance to build a one-room add-on. The loan will be used to purchase cement, cinder blocks, sand and iron and to pay for labour.

He hopes they will continue to give him a helping hand with these small loans which are a great help to the family, who really want to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina is 41 years old, married, and has five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for three years, and she earns additional income by selling charcoal and cultivating rice.

She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more items to resell at her general store, like chips, soap, shampoo, canned goods and eggs. Carina has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF, before this loan. She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to resell at her general store, like chips, soap, shampoo, canned goods and eggs.

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en:
Generosa is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a food preparation business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years, and she earns additional income by raising pigs.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy ingredients for her prepared food business.

Generosa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Salvador De Jesus

texts.es: Don Salvador vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo desde hace varios años y eso le ha dado la experiencia necesaria para asistir sus cultivos, sus cosechas las comercializa en los mercados de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Don Salvador solicita un crédito para poder comprar los insumos necesarios como fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos, entre otras cosas asi como muestra la fotografía para tener buenas cosechas y así el pueda obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica
texts.en:
Salvador lives with his partner and their two children in a house they own. He has been growing corn and sorghum for several years. This has given him enough experience to take care of his planting. Salvador sells his crops in markets of basic grain near his home. He uses the profits to take care of the household expenses.
Salvador is asking for a loan to buy supplies such as chemical fertilizers, manure, herbicides, etc, such as you can see in the picture. Like this, he can get good crops and increase profit so he can provide more economical stability for his family.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers, manure, herbicide, etc.

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es: Don José se dedica a la producción y venta de tejas y en invierno vende yuca la cual siembra en su temporada, pues es la única forma que tiene de cómo ganarse la vida y poder darle lo mejor a su familia, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, es una hombre trabajador y responsable pues se ha caracterizado siempre por darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
